title: the_shape_of_water
body: The Shape of Water is a 2017 romantic fantasy film directed and produced by [[Guillermo del Toro]], who co-wrote the screenplay with Vanessa Taylor. It stars Sally Hawkins, Michael Shannon, Richard Jenkins, Doug Jones, Michael Stuhlbarg, and Octavia Spencer. Set in 1962 Baltimore, Maryland, the film follows a mute cleaner at a high-security government laboratory who falls in love with a captured humanoid amphibian creature and decides to help him escape from death at the hands of an evil colonel. Filming took place on location in Ontario, Canada, from August to November 2016.

title: light_cruiser_princess
body:
A boss-tier special enemy character in [[Kantai Collection]]. 

Like many [[abyssal ship]]s, she has [[pale skin]], and [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]]. Unlike most Abyssals, she notably has [[parted bangs]], and an all-black version of the [[dress]], [[boots]] and [[elbow gloves]] that a [i][[Sendai (kancolle)|Sendai]][/i]-class would wear, replete with single-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turrets]], although her left arm is dominated by a large toothy maw bearing [[torpedo]] launchers and a glowing orb.  Another salient point is that she wears a bondage-style [[blindfold]] over her eyes with two curly [[horns]] sticking out of them.

The character design is an unmistakable reference to [[Jintsuu (kancolle)|Jintsuu]], and considering the event, is a reference to the IJN [i]Jintsuu[/i]'s sinking in the "Battle of Kolombangara":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Kolombangara], where [i]Jintsuu[/i] remained behind to let the destroyers escape, winding up being completely destroyed (split in half by torpedoes) by the Allied attack force.

title: hatakaze_(kancolle)
body:
Hatakaze (æ——é¢¨, lit. "flag wind") is the fifth of the nine [[kamikaze (kancolle)|Kamikaze]]-class destroyers as represented in [[Kantai Collection]]. 

h4. Appearance

Similar to her sister-ships, she wears a [[Meiji schoolgirl uniform]] with a loose gold [[haori]] over a white [[kimono]] top along dark grey-blue [[hakama short skirt]] tied with a sash bearing an [[anchor]] on the end, and [[brown footwear|brown]], [[lace-up boots|laced]], [[knee_boots|knee-high]], leather [[high heel boots|high-heeled]] [[boots]]. She has [[blue eyes|sky blue]] [[tareme]] eyes and [[blonde_hair|dirty blonde]]/[[brown_hair|brown]] [[drill hair]] with [[hair_between_eyes|bangs that come between her eyes]] in front and a medium-length [[ponytail]] held with a [[red_ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]] and mast-themed [[hair ornament]] in back.

Her [[machinery|rigging]] includes a [[smokestack|funnel]] attached to her back with an adjoining mast and two twin-tube [[torpedo]] launchers on either side of the funnel. Further out to the sides, at thigh-level, are cutoff-ship-deck-like platforms that bear a single-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]].  She also carries a single-cannon turret in her left hand like a pistol, which is modeled like a ship's bow in her left hand.

h4. Personality

Hatakaze has a polite, elegant, humble, and mature personality type that resembles the "Yamato Nadeshiko" ideal. Her official voiced lines involve many references about looking up to her older sister-ships, such as Kamikaze, or commenting on [[asakaze (kancolle)|Asakaze's]] night-aversion or [[harukaze (kancolle)|Harukaze's]] cooking.

h4. History

The historical IJN [i]Hatakaze[/i] was launched on March 15th, 1924. At the time of the Battle of Pearl Harbor, she was assigned to Destroyer Division 5 (alongside sister-ships Harukaze, Asakaze, and Matsukaze). Destroyer Division 5 took part as escorts or screens in many of the early South Pacific invasions of the war, including the invasion of the Philippines and Solomon Islands. During the latter of which, [i]Hatakaze[/i] participated in the "Battle of Sunda Straight":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Sunda_Strait], performing a torpedo attack against ABDA cruisers.

On the 2nd of March, 1943, [i]Hatakaze[/i] suffered an accidental explosion, and was forced to receive repairs for over a year, emerging in October of the following year. Following the dissolution of Destroyer Division 5, she was put directly into the Combined Fleet. On January 15th, 1945, she was sunk at port in what is now "Kaohsiung, Taiwan":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kaohsiung] by Allied aircraft.

h4. [i]Kamikaze[/i]-class Destroyers
* [[Kamikaze (kancolle)|]] - first Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [[Asakaze (kancolle)|]] - second Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [[Harukaze (kancolle)|]] - third Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [[Matsukaze (kancolle)|]] - fourth Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [b]Hatakaze[/b]

h4. See also
* [[Hatakaze (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links
* "Kancolle Wiki: Hatakaze":http://en.kancollewiki.net/Hatakaze
* "Kancolle English Wikia: Hatakaze":https://kancolle.fandom.com/wiki/Hatakaze
* "Wikipedia: Japanese destroyer Hatakaze (1924)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Hatakaze_(1924)]

title: katori_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese training cruiser [i]Katori[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. 
Character design by [[Parsley-F]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

h4. Personality
She is personified around the role of a [[teacher]], carrying a [[pointer]], (or [[riding crop]] for some artists,) and prominently wearing [[glasses]]. She talks in a mature, maternal, gentle, but also somewhat flirty tone.

h4. Appearance
She has light [[brown_hair|brown]] or [[silver hair]] tied into a [[folded ponytail]] with [[parted bangs]].  She has [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[green eyes]].  She wears a [[double-breasted]] white [[jacket]] with gold [[epaulettes]] over a white [[collared shirt]] and black [[necktie]] up top combined with a gray [[skirt]]/[[pencil skirt]], and [[pantyhose]] below. Her [[machinery]] involves a backpack-like rig holding up a smokestack and two twin-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]]s, as well as a bridge carried on a strap like a purse. Her shoes in this mode are armored [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[sandals]].

Her class was originally commissioned as training vessels as well as command vessels, especially for submarine or destroyer squadrons, but like with so much else in the Japanese arsenal, was hastily upgraded and pushed to front-line status as attrition weighed upon the IJN. This is reflected with her low maximum stats. She does have the bonus of having four slots and, as a training cruiser, an experience boost if used as a flagship in PvP.

h4. History
The historical [i]IJN Katori[/i] was named after the head Katori Shrine in Chiba Prefecture ("Katori" can translate to "Incense Acquisition"). She was sunk in "Operation Hailstone":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Hailstone] (aka The Raid on Truk Harbor to the Japanese), under the bombardment of the American battleship USS [i][[Iowa (kancolle)|]][/i] on the 17th of February, 1944. It is said that Admiral [[Raymond A. Spruance]] explicitly halted the airstrikes against her so she could be used as [b]live target practice.[/b]

h4. [i]Katori[/i]-class training cruisers
* [b]Katori[/b]
* [[Kashima (Kancolle)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Katori[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_cruiser_Katori]

title: destroyer_water_oni
body:
A special boss-type enemy in [[Kantai Collection]], introduced in the Fall 2015 event, centered around the "Solomon Islands Campaign":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solomon_Islands_campaign].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[pale skin]], and orangish-[[red eyes]]. She has what looks like half an [[abyssal ship]] destroyer on her head with glowing eyes worn like a hat.  Underneath the [[teeth]], she is wearing shreds of a [[black serafuku]] on top, and black [[boots]] and [[gloves]]. On her back is a hip-mounted abyssal variation of destroyer [[rigging]], with two large black arms bearing twin-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]].

She notably holds a blue [[tasuki]], similar to the one [[Kaga (kancolle)|Kaga]] wears.

She is likely an homage to the destroyers sunk in the "Battle of Vella Gulf":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Vella_Gulf], where four IJN destroyers, [i][[Hagikaze (kancolle)|Hagikaze]][/i], [i][[Arashi (kancolle)|Arashi]][/i], [i][[Shigure (kancolle)|Shigure]][/i], and [i][[Kawakaze (kancolle)|Kawakaze]][/i], were completely surprised by an American force of six destroyers in the middle of the night due to Americans using radar on their destroyers, while the Japanese did not (this being one of the first times the Japanese used destroyers on their own without a cruiser leader). The battle was a disastrous rout for the Japanese, with the Americans destroying all but [i]Shigure[/i] and never receiving any return fire, and afterwards, the Japanese gave up even trying to resupply their Solomon Island bases with destroyers, significantly hastening Japan's bloody retreat in the Solomon Island Campaign. 

Destroyer Water Demon may be a corrupt reflection of the merger of the three sunken destroyers, like [[Light Cruiser Oni]], or may simply be [[Hagikaze (kancolle)|Hagikaze]], alone, whose [[side ponytail]] is not easily distinguishable, considering the visible tie to [[Kaga (kancolle)|Kaga]].

title: matsukaze_(kancolle)
body:
Matsukaze (æ¾é¢¨, lit. "Pine Wind") is fourth of the nine [[Kamikaze (kancolle)|]]-class destroyers in [[Kantai Collection]]. 
Character design by [[Parsley-F]], voiced by [[Itou Shizuka]].

h4. Appearance

Similar to her sister-ships, she wears a [[Meiji schoolgirl uniform]] with a white [[furisode]] top along with a dark green [[hakama skirt]] tied with a sash bearing an [[anchor]] on the end, and [[knee_boots|knee-high]] [[lace-up boots]]. She has [[green eyes|green]] [[tsurime]] eyes and [[short_hair|short]], [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[black hair]] with [[swept bangs]] in front and a short cow-lick [[ahoge]] up top. She also wears a [[mini top hat]] tilted to the right side of her head.

Her [[machinery|rigging]] includes a [[smokestack|funnel]] attached to her back with an adjoining mast and two twin-tube [[torpedo]] launchers on either side of the funnel. Further out to the sides, at thigh-level, are cutoff-ship-deck-like platforms that bear a single-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]]. She also carries a single-cannon turret in her left hand like a pistol, which is modeled like a ship's bow.

h4. Personality

Matsukaze has a confident, competitive, and tomboyish (and refers to herself with the boyish "boku", similar to [[hatsuzuki (kancolle)|Hatsuzuki]], among others), but also fairly warm personality. Unlike some of her sisters, she's not afraid of the night, and in her hourlies, greets them in the morning.

h4. History

The historical IJN [i]Matsukaze[/i] was launched October 30th, 1923. At the time of The Battle of Pearl Harbor, she was assigned to Destroyer Division 5 (alongside sister-ships [[Harukaze (kancolle)|]] and [[Asakaze (kancolle)|]]). As one of the more obsolete classes of destroyers, her early-war career was spent escorting troop transports for invasions, although in the Battle of Sunda Straight, she helped sink an auxiliary minesweeper.

Throughout the middle of the war (1943-1944), [i]Matsukaze[/i] was engaged in "Tokyo Express" expeditions. [i]Matsukaze[/i] was at Truk during Operation Hailstone, but survived with no direct hits from major ordinance. Later in the year, while escorting a convoy near Saipan, [i]Matsukaze[/i] was struck by a torpedo from the USS [i]Sailfish[/i] and sank on August 25th, 1944.

h4. Trivia

Her boyish character, androgynous appearance and Taisho-era clothing have drawn comparisons with "Takarazuka Revue":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Takarazuka_Revue and the otokoyaku role.

h4. [i]Kamikaze[/i]-class Destroyers

* [[Hatakaze (kancolle)|]]
* [b]Matsukaze[/b]

h4. See also

h4. External links

title: andrea_doria_(warship_girls_r)
body:
[i][[Warship Girls R]][/i]'s personification of the Italian battleship [i]Andrea Doria[/i]. Character designed by [[Jianren]]. 

h4. Appearance
She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] styled into [[twintails]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of set of black [[ribbon]]s with red and white dice, a [[choker]], a shoulder-less white and red top exposing her [[midriff]], [[bandaid]], a pair of brown [[gloves]], a blue [[skirt]] held in place with a leather [[belt]], [[striped legwear|striped]] [[thighhighs]] and a pair of light blue see through [[anklet]]s.

Her machinery is based on the dreadnought configuration of five [[ship turret|turret]]s of varying numbers of 12-inch [[cannon]] with her arm mounted turret representing her amidships armament.

She received a remodel (post #2019755) in patch 1.3.3 based on her historical reconstruction to a more modern battleship. This version of her is still quite physically similar to her former self, sporting a new [[sailor collar]] as part of her upper outfit, an anchor [[brooch]], the removal of her arm mounted turret, a pair of light blue see through [[bangle]]s and another two similar pieces of jewelry adorning her twin tails representing the installation of a "Pugliese Torpedo Defense System":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Littorio-class_battleship#Pugliese_torpedo_defense_system].

As part of the "Children's Day 2016":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Children%27s_Day] update an [[official alternate costume]] (post #2399989) was made available featuring a [[aged down]] version of Andrea in a [[shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], clutching a [[book]], larger hair ribbons and a bandaid in the location where her amidships turret used to be.

h4. Personality
Andrea is a thoroughbred [[tsundere]], initially disappointed with the player on acquisition, only really opening up with her remodeled version. Due to her similarities of both personalities and looks with [[Akizuki Airi]] she earned the nicknames "Airi" and "Daughter" among players and memed so hard among the community it effected the reveal and design of her sister ship [[caio duilio (warship girls r)|Caio Duilio]].

h4. See also
* [[Andrea Doria (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: [i]Andrea Doria[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_battleship_Andrea_Doria]

title: arashio_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body: With her second remodel released in the 25th January 2017 update, she wears the uniform shared by the rest of the remodeled Asashio-class. Arashio's version consists of a [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] under a [[frilled_dress|frilled]] [[pinafore dress]] and [[black pantyhose]]. Her equipment consists of a hand-held [[ship turret|turret]], two [[torpedo|torpedo launchers]] [[thigh_strap|strapped]] to her thighs, a [[searchlight]] resembling a [[crime prevention buzzer]] and a [[daihatsu_(landing_craft)|daihatsu]] attached to her backpack straps.

title: hood_(warship_girls_r)
body:
[[Warship Girls R]] character.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a small [[ahoge]] and a vibrant pink flower shaped [[hair ornament]]. She also wears a pair of [[red-framed eyewear|red]] [[semi-rimless eyewear|semi-rimless]] [[glasses]]. Her outfit consists of a military themed officer's outfit in black with white cuffs, a white [[capelet]] all with gold trim, prominent [[aiguillette]], a blue [[plaid skirt]] and white [[thighhighs]].

Her machinery is equally split between both sides of her, mounting two superfiring [[ship turret|turret]]s of twin 15-inch [[cannon]] to her left and right representing her forward and stern main armament configuration. Her ship funnels and a mast flying the [[white ensign]] are mounted behind her.

On August 29th, Hood's remodeled artwork (post #2401044) was revealed as part of the Project R trailer and her remodel was released with patch 2.0 in early November. This version of Hood's hair ornament changes color to purple, her military uniform's base colors change to white with blue cuffs and capelet. Her footwear now features a blue cross shaped pattern with a [[union jack]] on her right leg. 

The machinery is also updated to include two red and white armor plates mounted forward to protect her legs and thighs, the addition of a pair of twin 4-inch turrets and a pair of British 2 Pounder 8 Barrel "Pom-Pom" anti-air guns mounted to her rear. The mast is replaced with the ship's spotting top featuring type 284 gunnery radar.

Hood is depicted as a well-spoken, serene woman, exemplifying true British values such as sipping tea, staying calm and carrying on. Her bad eyesight is accredited to HMS Hood's inability to discern the difference between Prinz Eugene and Bismarck during the opening phases of the Battle of Denmark Strait. She may be suffering a degree of breast envy, padding out her chest area with one of the ship's cats, Fishcakes.

A bug with her remodel's [[chibi]] battle sprite where she would be stuck in a permanent [[@_@]] state after taking damage of any kind has associated her with the facial expression.

She is regularly paired with [[bismarck (warship girls r)|Bismarck]] either as bitter rivals, in some form of [[Yuri]] situation or both at the same time. She may also be seen as the leader of other Royal Navy characters due to her remodel's skill requiring that she be made flagship of any formation to take effect.

She is based on the British Royal Navy's "HMS Hood":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Hood], an Admiral-Class warship named after "Admiral Samuel Hood":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_Hood,_1st_Viscount_Hood]. Her ship index number is 1.

Her original artist was [[JS Sang]] but with her remodel her art was replaced with [[15k]].

h4. See also

* [[Hood (Azur Lane)]]

title: rodney_(warship_girls_r)
body:
[[Warship Girls R]] character.

Rodney has [[blonde hair|blonde]] low-tied hair with the tail end resting on or just [[hair over shoulder|over her right shoulder]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit is a late 18th/early 19th century inspired [[military uniform|Royal Navy officer's uniform]] made of up of a black [[bicorne]] [[hat]] with golden trim, an embroidered blue coat with red facings, cuffs, collar, golden [[epaulettes]], [[aiguillette]], a pair of white [[gloves]], a red [[sash]] worn around the waist, a white [[skirt]] and white [[thighhighs|thighigh]] boots.

A large portion of her machinery is located on her right side with all three of her triple 16-inch gun [[ship turret|turrets]] representing the design of the Nelson-class where all main armaments were located forward of the super structure. On her left a large curved shield in the shape of a ship's stern is used as protection. There are several additional turrets of double 6-inch guns located on the inner ring of the machinery as a secondary armament with a mast and crane in the back. 

Rodney received a remodel early in the game's life. This version of Rodney sees her entire outfit swap colors with red replacing blue and blue replacing red. The plumage on her bicorne increases with new white plumage mixed into the fray. There's an additional white sash draping down from her left shoulder with golden trim added to almost all pieces of clothing. White [[garter straps]] are also made visible.

The machinery is augmented with a green and blue camouflage paint scheme. The main turrets and the rear section of the machinery mounts multiple single 20mm Oerlikon cannons and a single 2 Pounder 8 Barrel "Pom-Pom" anti-air gun. On one turret a Supermarine Walrus rests on a seaplane catapult. The inner ring of equipment is removed with three of the four 6-inch turrets now located on the more ship like designed stern, better representing how these secondary batteries were positioned. The mast has also been replaced with a smokestack and the ship's conning tower with various gunnery and aircraft detecting radar.

On Children's Day 2015 a child version of unmodified Rodney was awarded as a quest reward, with lighter colored machinery covered in crayon graffiti. 

A kind individual concerned with the success of her sister and a lover of a nice Atlantic Sea breeze. A combination of her pleasant remodel art and her powerful armor piercing BIG SEVEN special attacks have made her one of the most ringed ships in the game.

Her [[chibi]] battle sprite was one of the first to be revealed as a combatant in the Project R trailer .

In April 2016 Rodney was likened to English teacher [[Ellen Baker]] due to their almost identical looks and their English speaking backgrounds, with [[15k]] posting an image of Rodney swinging one of her main turrets like a baseball bat.

She is based on the British Royal Navy's "HMS Rodney":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Rodney_(29)] a Nelson-class inter-war warship named after "Admiral George Brydges Rodney":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Brydges_Rodney,_1st_Baron_Rodney]. Armed with 16-inch [[cannon|main guns]] she was one of the [i]Big Seven[/i] warships. Her ship index number is 9.

Her official artist is [[15k]].

title: kashima_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese training cruiser [i]Kashima[/i].  She was named after the [[Shinto]] shrine Kashima Jingu, but her name literally means "deer island".
Character design by [[Parsley-F]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

h4. Personality
Perhaps even more than Katori, she has a highly feminine personality. Her verbal habit is to end most of her lines in "ufufu", which is usually seen as a coquettish laugh. Several of her in-game lines also paint her as someone who wistfully longs for peace, a reference to both the fact that she, as a training vessel, isn't much of a warrior and lacks any confidence in her combat ability, and the fact that the historic ship was commissioned during the peace before the war, engaged in essentially no combat the whole duration of the war, and was used as a repatriation vessel after the war before being scrapped in Japan. (Personality-wise, this makes her similar to [[inazuma (kancolle)|Inazuma]].)  Her in-game lines portray her as lacking in self-confidence and happiest when cooking or brewing coffee for others. Unlike Katori, she's generally shown as a gentle girl who shows her admiral kindness if not affection, making her particularly popular. This has sometimes resulted in a particularly lustful/lewd image, partially from all the doujins she's recieved as as result of her popularity.

h4. Appearance
Kashima has [[blue eyes|bluish]]-[[grey eyes]] with a [[tsurime]] style, and [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[grey hair]] tied into [[twintails]], with [[sidelocks]] in the front. She also has [[large breasts]].

Similar to her sister-ship, she wears a [[white jacket|white]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[double-breasted]] [[military jacket]] with black [[buttons]] and trim, along with gold [[epaulettes]] and a [[red neckerchief]].  She wears [[white gloves]], has a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] charcoal/[[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]], [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and sandal-like shoes.  She wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]] with two flag-like flaps of cloth accentuating it. These flags appear to be the signal flags Uniform and Yankee. When flown together these mean "I am carrying out exercises. Please keep clear of me", referring to Kashima's status as a training cruiser. When damaged, it appears she wears [[no bra]] and [[no panties]].

Kashima's [[machinery|combat gear]] involves a large pair of [[binoculars]], her depth charge launcher carried like a briefcase, her bridge carried on a strap like a purse, and a back-mounted weapons platform with twin [[searchlight|searchlights]], and a large and small pair of twin-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turrets]].

For Christmas 2015, she was given a red knit sweater with fur trimming, a Christmas [[capelet]] and a Christmassy version of her hat. She is seen holding a popper.

For a campaign with [i][[Lawson]][/i] in February 2016, she was designated, along with Katori, to wear the Lawson uniform.

h4. History
Historically, the IJN [i]Kashima[/i] was designated for front-line duty, leading landings or being a flagship for fleet action, during the earlier parts of the war, but never actually saw combat, before being sent back to resume its intended role as a training ship.  As a training ship, she was notably a much slower ship, and not as particularly well-armed as most other light cruisers. During the last year of the war, however, the desperate Japanese pressed her into service as a transport and as an anti-submarine patrol ship.  During this time, she collided with and sank a transport ship, [i]Daishin Maru[/i], marking the only kill of her career. She survived the war, was used as a repatriation vessel, and was kept by the Japanese, eventually being broken up for scrap.

h4. [i]Katori[/i]-class training cruisers
* [[Katori (Kancolle)|]]
* [b]Kashima[/b]

title: de_ruyter_(kancolle)
body:
A [[Kantai Collection]] character based on HNLMS De Ruyter, which was a unique light cruiser of the Royal Netherlands Navy. She is one of many ships named after Dutch naval hero Admiral "Michiel Adriaenszoon de Ruyter":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michiel_de_Ruyter. She is the first ever Dutch shipgirl as well as the first ever shipgirl for her artist [[Sara (kadokawa)|]].

De Ruyter has [[long hair|long]] [[curly hair|curly]] brownish [[red hair]] with a [[side braid]] and [[blunt bangs]], and [[green eyes]]. She wears a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[brown shirt|beige]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[green sailor collar]], an [[orange neckerchief]] and [[chain]]s held by a golden [[bell]], and a [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]] as well as a [[black belt]] with more chains and [[anchor]]s, short [[black thighhighs|black]] [[over-kneehighs|over-knee socks]], and [[green footwear|green]] [[high_heels|high-heeled]] [[shoes]]. Her [[machinery]] includes six of her seven 150-mm guns ([[adapted turret|she holds the seventh in her hand]]), her tall forward superstructure, a [[smokestack]], and several smaller [[ship turret|turret]]s. She also wears a [[black hairband]] with midships aircraft catapult attached to it.

Because her artist is an in-house illustrator, she got her first seasonal CG almost three weeks after she was introduced into the game through the 2019 Autumn event while said event was still ongoing. This seasonal CG, a Christmas-themed one, shows her wearing a [[red dress]] with a [[corset]], a [[white skirt|white]] pleated skirt, a [[white capelet]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[holly hair ornament]], black thighhighs, and [[fur-trimmed_boots|fur-trimmed]] [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. She also has a [[Setsubun]] CG where she wears a [[red coat|red]] [[plaid coat]], a [[brown sweater]], a [[black skirt|black]] pleated skirt, an [[orange scarf]], black thighhighs, and black [[fur-trimmed boots]].

She comes off as a preppy girl who has a penchant for using the expression "Yabai" in both good and bad contexts.

The historical De Ruyter was laid down on 16 September 1933 at the Wilton-Fijenoord dockyard in Schiedam and commissioned on 3 October 1936. She was sunk in the Battle of the Java Sea in 1942.

h4. See Also

title: graf_zeppelin_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]] personification of the German aircraft carrier [i]Graf Zeppelin[/i].
Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Hayami Saori]].

h4. Personality
Graf Zeppelin has a confident, militaristic, blunt, and stoic manner of speech. Her [[official art|(official) art]] style has her looking quite cold and nearly monochrome, most likely to reflect on her historic counterpart's noncompletion. She is frequently seen in the company of the other German ships, especially [[bismarck (kancolle)|Bismarck]] and [[prinz eugen (kancolle)|Prinz Eugen]], and occasionally as having a senpai-kouhai relationship with [[Akagi (kancolle)|Akagi]], from whom some of her flight deck design was copied. As her hourlies implies, she's an avid coffee drinker, making coffee up to four times between 10 pm to 7 am.

h4. Appearance
She has [[grey eyes]] in [[tsurime]] style. She has [[blonde hair]] with notable [[sidelocks]] and [[twintails]], as well as [[hair between eyes|hair dangling between her eyes]].

She wears a white [[jacket]] that is unmistakably [[impossible_clothes|impossibly tight]] on her [[large breasts]] and even shows her navel. She also wears a [[capelet]] with red trim, a black-and-red [[necktie]] bearing a black (iron) [[cross]], a black [[miniskirt]], [[black pantyhose]], black [[gloves]] and a [[peaked cap]].

Her [[machinery|combat gear]] involves a split-hull design similar to KanColle battleships like [[Nagato (kancolle)|Nagato]]. Unlike Japanese carriers, she carries no historical weapon representing aircraft launching, instead holding a small deck of two twin-[[cannon]] anti-air [[ship turret|turrets]] like a pistol. Her hull also has twin-cannon turrets. Her carrier deck is carried on a robotic swing arm from the back of the hull that is attached to her back on a metal girdle.

h4. History
The historic Graf Zeppelin was also notable for incorporating design flaws the other major powers had already learned to avoid. Graf Zeppelin's surface armament was 16 single-purpose 15 cm guns in 8 twin-mount casemates, at a time when other countries were arming their carriers with smaller dual-purpose guns to increase their anti-air coverage. These guns were of heavy cruiser size, numbered more than a heavy cruiser would carry for "commerce raiding operations" and would have required the carrier to come into direct surface engagement range to actually use. This was in fact the result of miscommunication with the ship's designer, who intended to save weight by using 4 twin-mount instead of 8 single-mount casemates; the builders thought that he was instead telling them to double the total number of guns. In game, though, this trait is the reason she's able to attack during night battles, the first night carrier in the game (though not night airstrike combat-capable).

h4. See also
* [[Graf Zeppelin (Azur Lane)]]
** [[Peter Strasser (Azur Lane)|Her unbuilt sister ship Peter Strasser]]
* [[Graf Zeppelin (Warship Girls R)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: [i]Graf Zeppelin[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_aircraft_carrier_Graf_Zeppelin]

title: nelson_(warship_girls_r)
body:
A battleship class character in [[Warship Girls R]].

Nelson has [[orange hair|orange]] sometimes bordering [[red hair|red]] hair pulled back into a [[long hair|long]] low [[ponytail]] which can often be missed and [[blue eyes]]. A mole sits just beneath her [[mole under eye|right eye]] which she keeps [[one eye closed|closed]] at all times. Her outfit is based on Horatio Nelson's admiral [[military uniform|uniform]]. An embroidered black coat with golden [[epaulettes]] and trim sits atop a white frilled undershirt with her right sleeve rolled up to the elbow. White [[gloves]], a red [[skirt]] and a pair of black [[thighhighs|thighhigh]] boots finish the outfit off. She's also personally armed with a Royal Navy officers' sword with a black grip and golden hilt. Her closed eye and rolled up sleeve are a reference to the permanent wounds suffered by Admiral Nelson.

A large portion of her machinery is located on her right side with all three of her triple 16-inch gun [[ship turret|turrets]] representing the design of the Nelson-class where all main armaments were located forward of the super structure. On her left a large curved shield in the shape of a ship's stern is used as protection. There are several additional turrets of double 6-inch guns located on the inner ring of the machinery as a secondary armament with a mast in the back. 

She received a remodel (post #2244658) early in the game's life. Nelson's uniform mostly remains the same but with added [[medal|medals]], a red and blue [[sash]] draping down from her right shoulder, black [[garter straps]] attached to her boots and she clutches onto a golden [[pocket watch]].

The machinery is painted in green and blue camouflage. Two of her main turrets and the rear section of the machinery mounts an excessive number of single 20mm Oerlikon cannons and the central turret plays host to a 2 Pounder 8 Barrel "Pom-Pom" anti-air gun. The inner ring of equipment is removed with three of the four 6-inch turrets now located on the more ship like designed stern, better representing how these secondary batteries were positioned. The mast has also been replaced with a smokestack and the ship's conning tower with various gunnery and aircraft detecting radar.

A woman whose devotion to duty drives her to greater achievements she also endeavors to inspire those around her, [i]England expects that every man do his duty[/i] after all.

She is based on the lead ship of the British Royal Navy's Nelson-class inter-war warship "HMS Nelson":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Nelson_(28)] named after "Vice Admiral Horatio Lord Nelson":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horatio_Nelson,_1st_Viscount_Nelson]. Armed with 16-inch [[cannon|main guns]], she was one of the [i]Big Seven[/i] warships. Her ship index number is 8.

Her official artist is [[15k]].

title: ancient_destroyer_oni
body:
[[abyssal ship|Abyssal]] boss in the game [[Kantai Collection]]. First appeared during the 2016 Fall Event.

Like many Abyssals, she has [[pale skin]], and [[glowing eyes|glowing]] [[blue eyes|eyes]]. There is a [[mole under eye|mole]] under her left eye. Her hair is [[short hair|short]] (or bound-up), [[black hair|black]] (with a white [[streaked hair|streak]]), and styled in the [[side_drill|very uncommon]] [[side ponytail|side]][[drill hair|-drill]]. Additionally, there is an [[anchor hair ornament]] on the end of a [[single sidelock]].

Her clothing is all blacks and greys. She is dressed in a [[meiji schoolgirl uniform]] that consists of a grey [[kimono]], black [[hakama skirt]] & [[obi]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots|high-heeled]] [[boots]]. She also appears to wear [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow]] [[gloves]]. 

She is armed with a monstrous Abyssal [[cannon|gun]] [[ship turret|turret]], replete with one-and-a-half horrific, [[teeth|toothy]] maws, bristling with gun barrels, disturbingly organic-looking [[mechabare]], and a [[hose]] dangling from the bottom.

While it is [i]very[/i] easy to mistake her for [[Ancient Destroyer Princess]], there are some key differences:
* Oni looks far more intact and composed, while Princess looks significantly more damaged.
* Oni's Abyssal turret gun is one mouth grafted to another top set of teeth and a broken, incomplete jaw, while Princess's turret looks more completed: it has merged and integrated the two upper sets of teeth into one, centralized the lower jaw, and fixed up the machinery parts inside.
* Oni's hair is either shorter or pinned up, while Princess's is much longer and/or hanging down freely.
* Oni's side-drill is shorter.
* Oni lacks the white tasuki that Princess wears.

h4. See also

* [[kamikaze (kancolle)|]]
* [[battleship princess]]

title: ancient_destroyer_princess
body:
[[abyssal ship|Abyssal]] boss in the game [[Kantai Collection]]. First appeared during the 2016 Fall Event. Extremely similar in appearance to [[Ancient Destroyer Oni]].

She has [[pale skin]] and [[glowing eyes|glowing]] [[blue eyes|eyes]]--features common to most Abyssals--and a [[mole under eye|mole]] under her left eye. Her hair is [[long hair|long]], [[black hair|black]] (with a white [[streaked hair|streak]]), and styled in the [[side_drill|very uncommon]] [[side ponytail|side]][[drill hair|-drill]]. Additionally, there is an [[anchor hair ornament]] on the end of one of her unevenly-long[[sidelocks]].

Her black and grey clothing is noticeably [[torn clothes|shredded and torn]], apparently due to taking damage. She is dressed in a [[meiji schoolgirl uniform]] that consists of a grey [[kimono]], black [[hakama skirt]] & [[obi]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots|high-heeled]] [[thigh boots|thigh]] [[boots]]. She also wears [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow]] [[gloves]] on her arms, and a white [[tasuki]] on her right shoulder.

Her gun is strangely much more put-together than she is: a monstrous Abyssal [[cannon|gun]] [[ship turret|turret]] mounted atop a mouth-and-a-half filled with [[teeth]], jaws, gun barrels, glowing [[energy]], and disturbingly organic-looking [[mechabare]]. The [[hose]] dangling from the bottom has detached and hangs loose.

While she is quite easily mistaken for [[Ancient Destroyer Oni]], there are some key differences:
* Princess looks like she's been through the wringer, as opposed to Oni, who seems quite undamaged.
* Princess's Abyssal gun turret looks more completed and properly built than Oni's; the two upper sets of teeth ahve been fixed and set neatly together, while the lower jaw sits in the center between them; the internal parts exposed by the open mouth look more deliberate and less haphazard.
* Princess's much longer hair hangs down in the back, while Oni's hair is either shorter or pinned up.
* Princess has a longer side-drill.
* Princess has a white tasuki on her right shoulder, while Oni does not.

h4. See also

* [[Kamikaze (kancolle)|]]
* [[Battleship Princess]]

title: deutschland_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the German pocket battleship/heavy cruiser [i]Deutschland[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Ran (Bukeranwu)]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[black hair]] with a red highlight in her bangs and a white highlight in her left sidelock. She has bright [[blue eyes]]. On her head is a [[black headwear|black]] [[peaked cap]] with a band of cloth fake teeth and [[goggles on headwear|goggles on it]]. She wears a [[double-breasted]] [[white shirt]] and a black [[long coat]] with red lining over it. On her left arm, she has a red [[armband]] with an [[iron cross]]. She wears [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots]] with red soles and a noticeable heel. She has red armored/mechanical gloves.

Her [[rigging]] is a twin-hull design with two mechanical jaws for hulls. She has two triple-barreled [[ship turret|turrets]] attached to the side of each hull, and smaller secondary turrets atop them. She carries a handheld [[gun]] colored black and red, with a fake-tooth grin near the muzzle.

title: massachusetts_(azur_lane)
body:
Third ship of the US Navy's [i]South Dakota[/i]-class battleships, USS [i]Massachusetts[/i] (BB-59), in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Enka (bcat)|]], voiced by [[Takahashi Rie]].

She has [[multicolored hair]] being mostly white on the outside, while green-cyan or black on the inside. She has [[dark skin]] and several [[body markings]] near her collarbone and on her abdomen. Her outfit consists of a black and white [[bikini top only|bikini top]] where the straps are attached to a [[choker]] with a Native American-esque design, a pair of black [[short shorts]] and an [[open_jacket|open]], [[black jacket]] that hangs [[off_shoulder|off her shoulders]]. In addition, she wears [[camouflage_footwear|camo-patterned]] [[combat boots]]. Her hairstyle and dark complexion leads many players to note similarities to [[Altera (Fate)|]].

Her [[rigging]] features three triple-barreled [[ship turret|turrets]], two of which are suspended at her sides, while the third is attached to the back rigging. A small section of hull plating is suspended from the turrets as well as smaller secondary turrets. Her back rigging is her superstructure and conning tower, featuring a [[radar dish]].

In real life, [i]Massachusetts[/i] was the only one of the class to have initially seen frontline service in the Atlantic/Mediterranean theaters, bombarding Casablanca in November 1942 (leading to her gunnery exchange with [[Jean Bart (Azur Lane)|]], in anchor at that time). She was only transferred to the Pacific in early 1943 to replace her sister South Dakota (then headed stateside for repairs), seeing action escorting the carrier forces.

Post-war, she was decommissioned in 1947, but it took until 1965 for her to become a museum ship.

title: tennessee_(azur_lane)
body:
h4. Description
Lead ship of the Eagle Union Tennessee-class battleships, USS [i]Tennessee[/i] (BB-43), in [[Azur Lane]].

Tennessee has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]] and [[dark skin]]. Her uniform consists of a [[white dress|white]] [[microdress]] styled after a [[double-breasted]] [[naval uniform]]. Her sleeves are [[detached sleeves|detached]] from the dress, covering her shoulders and wrapping around the back [tn](see [[California (Azur Lane)|California]])[/tn]. She has a has a [[blue coat|navy blue]], [[long coat]] tied around her neck with a [[high collar]] and a tiny [[necktie]]. She wears [[black thighhighs]], with "1919" written on her left thighhigh in reference to her launch date, and a [[white headwear|white]] [[peaked cap]] with orange-yellow paddle-like structures coming out the sides. 

Her [[rigging]] is composed of two hull structures to her side, four triple-[[ship turret|turrets]], and smaller AA-mounts on the the hulls. 

Voiced by [[Satou Rina]].

h4. Skins
* !post #2958376: Default

h5. History
Moored inboard of [i]West Virginia[/i], she escaped damage for the most part during the attack on Pearl Harbor. She was quickly restored to service in escort duties before being recalled to the West Coast in mid-1942 for an extensive reconstruction a la [[South Dakota (Azur Lane)|]].

Re-entering active service in 1943, she participated in shore bombardment duties from the Aleutians to Leyte, joining her sister in the battle line that engaged "Nishimura's fleet":/pools/9549 in the last battleship-to-battleship engagement in history. Later seeing service in Iwo Jima and Okinawa, the pair were decommissioned in 1947 and scrapped 12 years later.

h4. Related Characters

title: admiral_graf_spee_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the German pocket battleship/heavy cruiser [i]Admiral Graf Spee[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Ran (Bukeranwu)]], voiced by [[Fuchigami Mai]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[white hair]] with a red highlight and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[black dress]] with a notable [[underboob cutout]], a sewn-on toothy grin, red [[frills]], and [[white_belt|white belts]] crossing over the front. She has a [[red scarf]] with a derivative of the [[nazi war ensign]] on it, [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]].

Her [[rigging]] is much imposing, consisting of two jaw-hulls to her side, 2 triple [[ship turret|turrets]] and 2 quad [[torpedo tubes]]. She has enlargened [[mechanical arms]] with sharp, red finger-claws, that are gloves over her normal hands. She has a mechanical shark-like [[fish tail]], which may be just armor over her normal tail.

title: choukai_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s depiction of last ship of the Sakura Empire Takao-class heavy cruisers, IJN [i]Choukai[/i] (é³¥æµ·).

In her base appearance, she has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[swept bangs]], floppy [[dog ears]] similar to Takao, and [[brown eyes]]. She wears a [[double-breasted]] [[military uniform]] similar to Takao and Atago, except with some blue accents, a [[white skirt|white]], [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. Her rigging is composed of 5 twin-[[ship turret|turrets]], 2 quad [[torpedo tubes]], 2 [[smokestack|smokestacks]], and one plate bearing the [[sakura empire (emblem)|sakura empire emblem]].

Her default appearance is strikingly similar to [[Type 95_(girls'_frontline)|]] from [[Girls' Frontline]] (to the point that her introduction line obliquely touches on it). Considering her artist, [[kishiyo]], originally drew both characters, this may not be a coincidence.

h4. Description
Fourth ship of the Royal Navy Leander-class light cruisers, HMS [i]Ajax[/i], in [[Azur Lane]].

h5. Base Art
Ajax has [[long hair|long]], light [[purple hair]] with a [[two side up]] and [[pink eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a strapless white top and a [[red skirt|red]] [[high-waist skirt]] with [[plaid trim]] around the waist. She has a white [[capelet]] adorning her shoulders tied with a [[yellow bow]] and an [[aiguillette]]. She wears [[black pantyhose]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. She has a pair of black, [[long sleeves|long]], [[detached sleeves]]. Topping off her head is a [[white headwear|white]] [[beret]] with red trim.

Her [[rigging]] is a spider-style design with four twin [[ship turret|turrets]] and two quad [[torpedo tubes]].

title: asakaze_(kancolle)
body:
Asakaze (lit. "Morning Wind") is the second of nine [[kamikaze (kancolle)|Kamikaze]]-class destroyers as personified in [[Kantai Collection]].

h4. Appearance

Similar to [[kamikaze (kancolle)|Kamikaze]], Asakaze wears a [[Meiji schoolgirl uniform]] with a white [[furisode]] top, including a gradient to blue in the loose sleeves, along with a cobalt blue [[hakama skirt]] tied with a sash bearing an [[anchor]] on the end, and [[knee_boots|knee-high]] [[lace-up boots]]. She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]], [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[light brown hair]] with [[parted_bangs|her bangs parted in the middle]] providing long [[sidelocks]] and exposing her [[forehead]]. She also wears two large blue [[hair_ribbon|hair ribbons]] on either side of her head.

Her [[machinery|rigging]] includes a [[smokestack|funnel]] attached to her back with an adjoining mast and twin-tube [[torpedo]] launcher. To her sides, at thigh-level, are cutoff-ship-deck-like platforms that bear a single-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]]. She also carries a single-cannon turret in her left hand like a pistol, which is modeled like a ship's bow bearing the number "5". 

h4. Personality

Asakaze has an energetic personality, proud of her accomplishments but also highly sensitive to criticism. Her in-game lines include several instances of indignation over perceptions of anyone "making fun of her" even when none existed. Possibly because of the meaning her name, she also seems to love mornings, getting up at 4 AM to see the sunrise. Inversely, she becomes notably more nervous at night, likely due to the circumstances of her sinking.

h4. History

Originally commissioned merely as "Destroyer No. 3" as part of the "8-8 Fleet Program,":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eight-eight_fleet the name [i]Asakaze[/i] was only assigned in 1928, five years after launch. At the time of the Attack on Pearl Harbor, [i]Asakaze[/i] was part of Destroyer Division 5, alongside sister-ships [i][[harukaze (kancolle)|Harukaze]][/i], [i]Matsukaze[/i], and [i]Hatakaze[/i].

Already aging by the start of the war, Asakaze mostly escorted landing craft in campaigns like "the Philippines":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines_Campaign_(1941%E2%80%9342)], "Java":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Java], and "Andaman Islands":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invasion_and_occupation_of_the_Andaman_Islands_during_World_War_II]. At the "Battle of Sunda Straight":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Sunda_Strait], [i]Asakaze[/i] launched torpedoes that assisted in the sinking of HMAS [i]Perth[/i] and USS [i]Houston[/i].

Throughout most of the rest of the war, she was a convoy escort ship. [i]Asakaze[/i] was torpedoed by the submarine USS [i]Haddo[/i] at 22:35 on August 23rd near Luzon while on escort duty. During the night, efforts to save her proved unsuccessful, and in the pre-dawn hours of August 24th, she capsized and sank. 

h4. Trivia

Although she was the second of the nine Kamikaze-class destroyers, due to IJN numbering at the time she was listed as "Destroyer No. 3" at launch due to sharing a number scheme with the "Wakatake-class destroyers":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wakatake-class_destroyer].

Her seiyuu is [[Itou Shizuka]].

h4. [i]Kamikaze[/i]-class Destroyers
* [[Kamikaze (kancolle)|]] - first Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [b]Asakaze[/b]
* [[Harukaze (kancolle)|]] - third Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [[Matsukaze (kancolle)|]] - fourth Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [[Hatakaze (kancolle)|]] - fifth Kamikaze-class destroyer

h4. External links
* "Kancolle Wiki: Asakaze":http://en.kancollewiki.net/Asakaze
* "Kancolle English Wikia: Asakaze":https://kancolle.fandom.com/wiki/Asakaze
* "Wikipedia: Japanese destroyer Asakaze (1922)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Asakaze_(1922)]

title: zara_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the Italian heavy cruiser [i]Zara[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)|]], voiced by [[Akasaki Chinatsu]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

Her default outfit consists of a [[white shirt]] with [[bare shoulders|shoulder]] and [[armpits|armpit cuts]], a black [[bodice]], [[red skirt]] with [[anchor|anchors]] attached, [[brown pantyhose]], [[grey footwear|grey boots]], red [[ascot]] and a [[mini hat]] patterned off her real-life fire control director. Her [[rigging]] is composed of two main hull pieces containing her four 203 mm twin [[ship turret|turrets]].

For her [[Zara due (Kancolle)|second remodel]], she loses the pantyhose and wears a [[garters|garter]] on her left thigh, while her skirt becomes [[layered skirt|layered]], with a layer of white underneath the red. She gains a [[cleavage cutout]] in her corset, and her boots now have [[high heels]]. Her hair now features a [[side braid]] on the left side of her face. For her machinery, the positions of her turrets is altered, and she gains additional secondary batteries and anti-aircraft guns. She now wields a [[seaplane]] launcher that resembles a [[Breda 30]].

title: fazz_(gundam)
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam Sentinel]].

[b]FA-010A FAZZ[/b]

A prototype [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by [[Anaheim Electronics]] as a physical proof of concept for the hugely powerful Full Armor [[ZZ Gundam]]. While some of the weaponry either had its power toned down or, in the case of the head mounted Hi-Mega Cannon, removed entirely, the FAZZ retained the mighty double [[beam rifle]], was structurally stronger due to lacking a transformation/combination mechanism (which the Full Armor ZZ would also omit). 

It also possessed a gargantuan external hyper mega [[beam cannon]] capable of accurately hitting targets thousands of kilometers away and more destructive than a battleship's main battery.

title: bell_pepper
body:
A vegetable with a hollow inside that has numerous little seeds that should be removed before cooking or eating. Unlike spicy peppers like habanero and jalapeno, bell peppers are sweeter in flavor and come in many different colors. [[bell pepper slice|Sliced bell peppers]] are a popular topping for [[pizza]].

Showing a character as disliking [[green pepper|green bell peppers]] is a common way to suggest they're childish.

title: fuwapuchi
body:
[b]FuwaPuchi[/b] is a line of [[character doll]]s by [[SEGA]], designed by [[Sanpati]], featuring [[Hatsune Miku]] as well as other [[Vocaloid]] characters and copyrights.

Also known as [b]fuwas[/b], or [b]fufu[/b] in Chinese, they have distinctive large heads with [[solid oval eyes|solid oval]] [[black eyes]], [[blush stickers]], and a D-shaped [[smile]] (though other expressions exist). They come in various sizes ranging from [[charm (object)|]]s to dolls large enough to wrap both arms around.

!post #3653479: FuwaPuchi size chart

h4. See also

* [[Fumo (doll)]], another distinctive line of dolls usually associated with the [[Touhou|Touhou Project]].
* [[Nesoberi]], a line of dolls featuring characters lying down on their stomach. Nesoberi versions of fuwas also exist.

h4. External links

* "SEGA site":[https://segaplaza.jp/lp/fuwapuchi/]

title: saberface
body:
A concept in [[Fate (series)|]] works originating from [[Takeuchi Takashi]]'s fondness for his character design of [[Saber (fate)|]] from [[Fate/stay night]]. As a result, many characters throughout the franchise are [[look-alike]]s resembling her, whether or not they were designed by Takeuchi.

This tag applies when [b]at least 3[/b] Saberfaces appear in a work, especially when they're grouped together. This doesn't apply to multiple variants of the same Saberface (i.e. [[alter servant]]s), where [[dual persona]] or [[multiple persona]] should be used instead.

Saberfaces include:
* [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]]
* [[Mordred (fate)|]]
* [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]]/[[Jeanne d'Arc Alter (fate)|]]/[[Jeanne d'Arc Alter Santa Lily (fate)|]]
* [[Laeticia (fate)|]]
* [[Nero Claudius (fate)|]]
* [[Okita Souji (fate)|]]
* [[Gray (fate)|]]
* [[Corpse King (fate)|]]
* [[Morgan le Fay (fate)|]]
* [[Le Loi (fate)|]]
* [[Lakshmibai (fate)|]]
* [[Aesc (fate)|]]

[[Hippolyta (fate)|]] has the same [[bun with braided base|hairstyle]] as Artoria but different facial features, so she's not a Saberface.

[[Yamato Takeru (fate)|]] was described by Takeuchi as a Saberface in an interview, but isn't considered one by [[Mysterious Heroine X (fate)|]] or in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[gameplay mechanics]].

h4. See Also
* pool #18457

title: grill
body:
A cooking device with a metal frame of parallel or crisscrossing bars used for cooking food over fire or other heating means.

This tag is not used for the UK definition for grill, which is a surface that can be heated to very high temperatures and under which you put food to be cooked.  That device is known as a broiler in the US.

h4. Types

* [[Kettle grill]]
* [[Shichirin]]

h4. See also

* [[Griddle]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: kettle_grill
body: A kettle grill is a charcoal [[grill]] consisting of half-spherical shaped grill with domed lid.  The base typically features support legs and may also feature a cylindrical ash catcher at the bottom.  The design was invented by George Stephen Sr. and was constructed from sheet metal half-spheres originally for building [[buoy]]s.  The American manufacturer Weber Inc. was the original maker of these grills, so the iconic design is closely associated with them.

title: kaku_seiga
body:
The "Wicked Hermit Who Passes Through Walls", also nicknamed Seiga Nyan Nyan  (é’å¨¥ å¨˜ã€… [ã›ã„ãŒ ã«ã‚ƒã‚“ã«ã‚ƒã‚“]), lit. Lady Seiga. Stage 4 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Ten Desires]] and owner of [[Miyako Yoshika]] respectively. Often also seen with [[Ibaraki Kasen]] as a fellow hermit. 

Her name came from the title and name of the heroine of "é’å¨¥":[https://zh.wikisource.org/wiki/èŠé½‹å¿—ç•°/ç¬¬07å·#.E9.9D.92.E5.A8.A5], an episode from "Strange Tales from a Chinese Studio":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strange_Tales_from_a_Chinese_Studio Volume 7.

* !post #1500910

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] with [[drill sidelocks]] and her [[hair stick]] through her [[hair rings]]. Her outfit is a [[blue dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[collared vest|collared]] [[open vest|open]] [[white vest]], a [[blue belt]] with a [[white flower]], [[white socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. She is often holding her [[ofuda]] or her [[hagoromo]]. 

Seiga's [[hair stick]] is actually a "Wall-Removing Chisel" that lets her pass [[through wall| through walls]]. It is likely based on a [[chisel]]-shaped magical digging tool that appeared in [i]Strange Tales from a Chinese Studio[/i].

title: tbh_creature_(meme)
body:
* !post #7052177: Yippee!

A four-legged white [[creature]] with a large head and [[pleading eyes|beady black eyes]] originally created by the "Twitter user @acmeiku.":https://twitter.com/acmeiku/status/1345224350551732225 It was popularized by a meme that took the drawing, added a confetti effect, and a voice clip of a child saying "Yippee!" 

It became the unofficial "mascot" of the [[autism|autistic]] community after a Tumblr user posted it with the caption "so obsessed with that thing, it's like the spokesperson for autism".

On Tumblr, it is commonly drawn interacting with [[Among Us]] [[crewmate (among us)|]]s.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: TBH / Autism Creature / Yippee":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/tbh-autism-creature-yippee

title: learning_with_manga!_fgo
body:
Official [[Fate/Grand Order]] comic handled by [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp)|]], distributed on the official F/GO website since August 2015. Ostensibly, by the title, one would learn about the daunting mechanics and immersive world of F/GO with [[Fujimaru Ritsuka (female)|]] and friends... except this "annoying looking" female Ritsuka, otherwise known as Gudako, is a gacha junkie. Elsewhere, a similarly "annoying looking" male [[Fujimaru Ritsuka (male)|Gudao]] is adventuring and engaging in homoerotic shenanigans, though he isn't the only one in the world doing so.

A smash hit with fans, the original run from August to November 2015 would be followed up by [i]More Learning with Manga! F/GO[/i], lasting from December 2015 to July 2017, and by [i]Even More Learning with Manga! F/GO[/i] since August 2017, each only occasionally as informative as it could be. Further popularized [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp) (style)|]]'s style, and would inspire countless fanart with its scenarios and quotable scenes. Would also introduce a number of original characters, listed below.

h4. Original characters
[tn]If named, they have probably been implemented into F/GO.[/tn]
* [[Rider (learning With Manga! Fgo)|Rider]] "Bunnygirl"
* [[Assassin (learning With Manga! Fgo)|Assassin]] "Babydoll"
* [[Paul Bunyan (Fate)|]]
* [[Mary Anning (fate)|]]
* [[Archer (learning With Manga! Fgo)|Archer]] "Bronco"
* [[Daikokuten (fate)|]]
* [[Saber (learning With Manga! Fgo)|Saber]] "Bearing"
* [[Lizzie Borden (Fate)|]] [tn](not implemented)[/tn]

title: otonashi_kotori
body:
An office clerk at 765 Production, Kotori is a character in The [[Idolmaster]].
Among the few things disclosed about her personality and character, Kotori is a little older than [[Miura Azusa]] (making her somewhere in her twenties), and despite not being an idol herself, loves to sing. She is typically regarded as a [[fujoshi]], but also carries some [[himejoshi]] traits in the 2011 anime.

Her last name literally means "soundless" and her first name means "little bird".


Usually depicted with [[short_hair|short]] [[green hair]], a [[mole]] on the [[mole_under_mouth|right side]] of her chin and a yellow [[headset]]

title: parfait
body:
A dessert, similar to a [[sundae]], made up of layers of [[ice cream]] or cream and [[fruit]] and/or fruit gelatin, served in a tall glass that makes all layers visible.

Usually eaten with a long-handle [[ice cream spoon]].

Many posts actually refer to the "American parfait":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_parfait while the traditional French parfait is made up of custard, cream, and fruit puree.

title: carl_carlson
body:
Carlton Carlisle "Carl" Carlson, Jr. is a recurring character in [[The Simpsons]] and a supporting character in The Simpsons Movie. He is a safety operations supervisor from Sector 7G of the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant, where he works alongside his childhood friends [[Lenny Leonard]] and [[Homer Simpson]].

Carl is a self-restrained organized (although not maniac about it, like Frank Grimes) employee and likes to call himself "an urban Lenny". It is hinted in the series that he and Lenny may be more than just friends.

title: lenny_leonard
body: Lenford Landon "Lenny" Leonard is a recurring character in [[The Simpsons]], and a supporting character in The Simpsons Movie. He is the best friend of [[Carl Carlson]] and, along with Carl, second best friend of [[Homer Simpson]], behind [[Barney Gumble]] and [[Moe Szyslak]]. He works at the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant and possesses a master's degree in nuclear physics, but he is portrayed as a simple, often naive, blue-collar working man. Lenny is also one of the few characters allowed to possess a "Simpson's Family" trait: Homer's beard line. He is also seen having extreme dandruff in some episodes.

title: astra_zero
body:
Artist who creates homoerotic artwork in a [[realistic]] [[painterly]] style.
The artist uses [[3D]] models for pose reference and claims to repaint the faces using [[procreate_(medium)|Procreate]] on "their twitter post":[https://x.com/astrazero/status/1768785081450324277] (asset #23940203). 
Despite this, there are significant differences between the styles in which they draw faces between 2022 and 2023, in which he [i]possibly[/i] started to inpaint faces using [[AI-assisted|AI]] with [[photorealistic]] models.

title: adepta_sororitas
body: The [b]Adepta Sororitas[/b] (Sisters of Battle) are a [[Warhammer 40K]] tabletop army. Generally considered the female equivalent to [[Adeptus astartes|Space Marines]], in that they are warrior nuns divided into chapters, wearing [[power armor]] and wielding [[bolter]]s. The Sisters of Battle are considerably more fanatical than their male counterparts, making greater use of religious iconography and symbolism.

title: gentildonna_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Ita: "Noblewoman"[/tn]

Japanese race [[horse]] sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Donna Blini. She is the Triple Tiara and Japan Cup winner of 2012, as well as the rival of [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]], [[Just A Way (racehorse)|]], and [[Verxina (racehorse)|]] (also of [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]], who also happens to be owned by Sunday Racing). After retiring from racing, she became a successful broodmare, most notably foaling [[Geraldina (racehorse)|]], who won the Queen Elizabeth II Cup in 2022.

title: rose_(nikke)
body:
An NPC from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

The late sister of [[Scarlet (nikke)|]]. She and her sister were members of a Nikke squad specialized in melee combat. Rose was also the original wielder of Fleetly Fading, Scarlet's signature weapon.

[spoiler]Upon realizing the nature of their squad where they are sent on numerous harsh missions in order to convert the last surviving member as a Grimms model, Rose incited a mutiny and murdered their former commander alongside other members of their squad who opposed the idea. Scarlet would eventually clash her sister in a duel, resulting in Rose's eventual demise.
