title: howto:get_started
body:
h4. Danbooru New Lurkers Guide

Greetings, Lurker! You have just entered one of the most comprehensively indexed and moderated repositories for anime-related art on the internet. In the next hour or so, you will learn how to take advantage of Danbooru's viewing and searching capabilities.

[quote]
[b]"READ THE RULES BEFORE PROCEEDING":/static/terms_of_service [/b]

This includes the [[help:upload rules|Upload Rules]], the [[help:community rules|Community Rules]], and the "Terms of Service":/static/terms_of_service. All users are obliged to follow these rules for everyone's benefit.
[/quote]

[quote]
[b]Stay With the Tour Guide![/b]

Please note that this guide only covers searching and browsing on Danbooru. You will sooner, later or already find that you can post things in here.

Posting anything here (this includes comments and forum messages) is regarded as contributing, and we strongly recommend that you read the [[howto:contribute|Lurker's Transformation Guide (on Becoming a Contributor)]] before posting.
[/quote]

[quote]
[b]Don't need any introduction?[/b]

You would be good enough to use Danbooru without reading any further by now if you have used "similar sites":https://gelbooru.com, but you are welcome to come back to this guide if you need to. [[help:cheatsheet|Search techniques]] such as use of metatags are largely identical, but Danbooru may use different tag names and impose additional restrictions.
[/quote]


h4. How Danbooru Works

h6. Anatomy of Danbooru

Here's how we organize our content:
* Danbooru hosts a collection of images called [b]Posts[/b], and each Post is an uploaded file. Pictures and [[animated|animations]] are supported. Supported formats are JPEG, PNG (including [[Animated PNG]]), GIF, SWF, and WEBM.
* Posts are described by [b]Tags[/b]. Our Tags are highly reused and deduplicated keywords used to identify the visual content, subject matter, composition or other information about a Post.
* [b]Pools[/b] are sub collections of Posts. They are used to keep Posts organized when Tags are not sufficient or ideal.
* Posts can also be annotated by [b]Notes[/b]. These notes are laid over the Post and contain text information. Notes can be hidden and revealed by clicking or tapping the Post.
* We have a special kind of [b]Artist[/b] Tag, simply called Artist for short. Artist are for identifying the original artists of a Post, and are a little different from other tags by having a specially formatted Wiki specially for artist information.
* Finally, we have [b]Wiki[/b] Pages, or just Wikis for short, which are single pages of text information to accompany Tags and Artists. Each Tag has a corresponding Wiki of the same name.

h6. Lingo

See our [[help:glossary|Glossary Help page]].

h4. Viewing Posts and Notes

h6. Posts

You may be already familiar with the Post listing view, as it is the first thing you saw when you first visited this site. A list of Post thumbnails will be presented to you. Clicking (or tapping) a thumbnail in the listing lets you see the Post in all its glory, along with its details and comments. There is also a search feature you can enter keywords into to find Posts of things you desire, but more on that later.

If you haven't yet done so, now is a good time to get to know Danbooru's "keyboard shortcuts":/static/keyboard_shortcuts, if you are browsing from a regular PC with a keyboard.

[quote]
[b]Protip![/b]

Pressing [b]Tab[/b] at least once gets you out of the search box if you want to cancel your search and continue browsing. You can now continue using the other shortcut keys.
[/quote]

h6. Post Color Codes

While browsing Danbooru in the Post listing view, you may notice that some thumbnails will have a brightly colored border. These are color codes representing the status of a Post, or the presence of strongly related Posts.

* [b]Green[/b] and [b]Yellow[/b] Posts have been linked to related posts. These are shown in the Post's detail view as thumbnails near the top. (Try it: search {{parent:any}})
* [b]Blue[/b] Posts are still being reviewed by Moderators, and will be deleted if it doesn't gain any Moderator approval. (Try it: search {{status:pending}})
* [b]Red[/b] Posts have been flagged for deletion by another user, usually due to policy violations or quality issues. View the Post to find out the reason it was flagged. (Try it: search {{status:flagged}})

Posts may have more than one color code at once. The color codes are taken from the [[help:posts|Posts help wiki]]. Please be aware that this approach is not without its limitations. There are pictures out there with [[border|borders]] as a compositional element that happen to be [[red_border|red]], [[green_border|green]], [[blue_border|blue]] or [[yellow_border|yellow]].

h6. Hot and Popular

If you want to see only the best of the best, there are two alternate Post listing views you can use.

* [b]Hot[/b] lists the highest-scoring, latest Posts. Only posts from the last two days are shown. Posts are generally ordered newest first, but older Posts with a high-enough score may be shown before newer ones.
* [b]Popular[/b] lists the highest-scoring Posts on a chosen day, week or month, ordered strictly by score. Choose from the available options to [[steins;gate|travel back and forth in time]].

[quote]
[b]Curious?[/b]

For the geeky and curious at heart, you can check out the exact algorithm behind the Hot Listing in the Danbooru's source code, at the bottom of "this file":https://github.com/r888888888/danbooru/blob/master/app/logical/post_query_builder.rb. See also forum #89137
[/quote]

h6. Notes & Translations

On some Posts you will notice translucent rectangles laid over the image. These are Notes, and hovering the mouse cursor over the white reveals the hidden information contained within.

Notes may be used to insert Translations without modifying the original post:
* Japanese [[4koma]] (yonkoma) translated to English: post #502527
* More Japanese [[comic]] translated English: post #280703 
* Long Japanese manga translated to English: post #691933 
* [[finnish_text|Finnish]] manga translated to English: post #1034157

Notes may also serve as labels:
* Large and Labelled Post: post #816844 
* Challenging Notes Exercise (small and hidden hover zones): post #889765 

Notes can be hidden by clicking or tapping on the image area in the Post. Repeatedly hiding and showing Notes may reveal hidden easter eggs.

h6. Tags

Tags are highly reused keywords and search terms that identify things that appear in a Post, making it easy to search images by text. For example, searching for witches and  apples (search: {{witch apple}}) returns Posts in which at least one witch and at least one apple appears.

[quote]
[b]More on that later...[/b]

Tag use and searching are described in greater detail in the section Searching Posts below.
[/quote]

Every Post will be indexed by a list of Tags that appear on the left side of the Post view. Get familiar with how they work by paying attention to the Tags used when viewing a post. If there's a visual or semantic element in a picture, it's got to have a name!

Tag Viewing Exercises

* Simple Solo Portrait (post #375036)
* Fantasy Action Shot (post #900072)
* Sensual Multi Large Format Portrait (post #687765)
* Manga Style Parody (post #148472)
* Touhou Project Cast Ensemble (post #459981)

Study the Post's tags, and notice how they relate to what is going on in the Post. You might learn something new!

Selecting a Tag on the left performs a search only with that Tag. When a search with only one tag is made, a link to view the Tag's associated Wiki appears. If the Tag has a Wiki, you can read up on whatever information has been written up for it.

h6. Scoring

Given enough time, a Post will eventually gain a score. Maybe the Post demonstrates great execution of artistic skill. Maybe it's an awesome concept or a piece of brilliantly written one-off manga.

A Post gains score when users on Danbooru add it to their Favorites or upvote it.

You could try filtering Posts by their score:

* Extremely high {{score:>100}}
* High score {{score:>50}}
* Low score {{score:<5}}
* Extremely low {{score:<0}}

Or by favcount:

* Extremely high {{favcount:>100}}
* High favcount {{favcount:>50}}
* Low favcount {{favcount:<5}}
* Extremely low {{favcount:<0}}

h6. Information

Along every Post there is some juicy scoop and technical details for those who are interested.

[b]ID[/b]

* A unique number assigned to every Post uploaded.
* Extremely useful as a shortcut to a specific Post on Danbooru.

[b]Uploader[/b]

* User who uploaded the Post.
* Follow this to view the User's profile, favorites and statistics.

[b]Approver[/b]

* User who approved the Post.
* Follow this to view the User's profile, favorites and statistics.

[b]Size[/b]

* Two kinds of size are shown here, data size and pixel size (in parentheses).
* Data size is the approximate amount of storage space on Danbooru required to keep the Post.
* Pixel size is the literal visual size, in pixels, of the Post when displayed on your screen.
* For large images, a downsized version is shown by default. The size shown is only for the full version of the image.
* The file extension is also indicated.

[b]Date[/b]

* Approximate amount of time the Post has been on Danbooru.
* Hover the cursor on this to reveal the exact time the post was uploaded (this is shown in a tooltip).
* Follow this to browse a listing of Posts uploaded on the same day.

[b]Source[/b]

* Site on the internet this Post was taken from.
* Follow this to get to where it all came from.
* Not all posts have a known source.
* Some sites require registration, even for a casual browse.

[b]Rating[/b]

* Level of sexuality to Danbooru's standards.
* Only sexuality is formally rated.
* Violence is informally rated by the absence or presence of the [[guro]] tag.
* There is no formal system to rate how political or counter-cultural a Post is.

[b]Status[/b]

* The impending fate of the Post.
* Posts with an [i]active[/i] status are likely to stay.
* A flagged or pending status may mean deletion for the Post, if it doesn't pass [[about:mod_queue|moderator review]].

As a history lesson, review the information on post #1. Who uploaded this post? How long has it been here?

[quote]
[b]Don't Lose the Information[/b]

A Post's information enables the powerful ability to search for Posts by more than just tags. For more information, read on to the next section of this guide, Searching Posts.
[/quote]

h4. Searching Posts

h6. Searching By Tags

Searching on Danbooru by tags should be easy, even for beginners, with the autocomplete feature. When you type a search term into the search box, a list of suggested tags will appear within a second. Choose from the list of tags which appear to include it in your search. Most fairly modern web browsers support this feature. For the full list of search capabilities and how to use them, see the [[help:cheatsheet|Search Cheatsheet]].

If you are still having trouble with searching by tags because what you are searching for isn't appearing, it may be due to differences between Danbooru's tagging conventions compared to other search engines that you have been using.

[quote]
[b]Two Tags Maximum[/b]

As a new Lurker, you will be limited to two tags per search until you get an upgraded account. For more details, refer to the section on [b]Upgrading[/b] end of this guide.
[/quote]

[b]Tag Conventions and Limitations[/b]
* Danbooru Tags are [b]separated by spaces[/b] (space delimited). This is why spaces cannot be part of a tag's name. Entering [i]hair ribbon[/i] implies two tags, [[hair]] and [[ribbon]].
* Tags made from more than one word use [b]underscores between words[/b]. You may have noticed this when using the tag autocomplete. To search for a [i]hair ribbon[/i], you will use [[hair_ribbon]].
* Punctuation marks may be used but [b]the asterisk (*) is reserved[/b] by Danbooru's search engine as a wildcard symbol. Emote (emoticon) tags, used as shorthand tags for facial expressions, are a good example of punctuation marks in tags.
* Symbols which are not easily input with a plain United States QWERTY PC keyboard layout (the one with the least symbols) are generally avoided where possible. This includes ligatures and diacritics in Latin alphabets, non-Latin orthography, mathematical symbols and emoji.
* [b]Examples:[/b] [[black_rock_shooter]] (no star), [[pokemon]] (no acute on the Ã©), [[:p]], [[>_<]], [[:3]] (shorthand facial expressions)

[b]Japanese-style Personal Names[/b]
* Danbooru follows the Japanese way of naming people and characters. Depending on the nationality or ethnicity of the person, the last name may be placed before the first name.
* Last name comes first for East Asians (Chinese, Japanese, Koreans, etc.).
* First name comes first for people of most other ethnic backgrounds, unless specifically advised otherwise. For people of mixed backgrounds (e.g. East Asian and non-Asian), it could go either way, so check your sources.
* If you are having trouble looking up a name, try switching the first and last names. You may find a tag for the person or character you are looking for, but in reverse!
* [b]Examples[/b]:  [[remilia_scarlet]], [[paul_robertson]] (surname last), [[ikari_shinji]], [[souryuu_asuka_langley]], [[park_sung_woo]] (surname first).

[b]Japanese Copyright Titles and Character Names[/b]
* There is currently no standard that which dictates when to use the Japanese name or the non-Japanese one. It could be either.
* Some characters are known by different names to Japanese and international audiences.
* It would be good to know both the Japanese title and the non-Japanese one when searching by copyright. Wikipedia is usually a good place to start. If the non-Japanese title doesn't work, try the Japanese one.
* [b]Copyrights[/b]: [[pocket_monsters]] & [[pokemon]] (both work), [[neon_genesis_evangelion]] (English Title for [i]Shinseiki Evangelion[/i]), [[ace attorney]] (English Title for the [i]Gyakuten Saiban[/i] series).
* [b]Characters[/b]: [[naruhodou_ryuuichi]] & [[phoenix_wright]] (aliased), [[mudkip]] (English for [i]Mizugorou[/i])

[b]Danbooru Vocabulary and Tag Groups[/b]
* Sometimes, Danbooru may use a different word for its tags. Because figuring out every synonym of the thing you are looking for can be a daunting endeavour, we have prepared a handbook of Danbooru tags, called the [[Tag Groups]].
* The [[Tag Groups]] is like a dictionary of Danbooru's vocabulary.
* We have prepared tag aliases to allow the search engine to recognize common synonyms to the tags we use. It is going to take a while before we cover every word, so for the meantime make use of the [[Tag Groups]].
* [b]Examples[/b]: [b]naga[/b] & [b]lamia[/b], [b]qipao[/b] & [b]china_dress[/b], [b]aeroplane[/b] & [b]airplane[/b], [b]rolled-up_pants[/b] & [b]pants_rolled_up[/b], [b]panty[/b] & [b]panties[/b].

h6. Tag Search
Successful searching by tags requires precise knowledge of the tags. If you are unsure about the name of the tag or its spelling, a tag search can be helpful. A tag search can be initiated by simply typing into a tag search box, using a feature which by now you will have known as autocomplete. 

Autocomplete only lists up to ten results per search. If for any reason you wish to view more than ten results, you can use the Tag Search feature accessible from the "Tags":/tags link on the top of the page. The search options should be self-explanatory.

The only difference between autocomplete and Tag Search is that the latter requires you to place your wildcards (on Danbooru it is the asterisk, [b]*[/b]) manually, while autocomplete tries to guess where you would have placed your wildcards.

Try the following searches in a search box, then use them in a tag search:
* panty
* panty[b]*[/b]
* [b]*[/b]panties
* panty[b]*[/b]([b]*[/b])
* [b]*[/b]([b]*[/b])
* [b]*[/b]([b]*[/b])[b]*[/b]([b]*[/b])

What results did you get? How are the autocomplete and Tag Search results different?

h6. Tag Qualifiers
When multiple meanings compete for a single tag, we need a means of [i]disambiguation[/i]. Our method of choice is to add [i]qualifiers[/i] at the end of tags, enclosed in parentheses.

Disambiguations:
* [b]Character[/b]: [[mario]] vs. [[mario_(cosplay)]] (character vs. dressing up as a character).
* [b]Character Names[/b]: [[shimakaze (kancolle)]] vs. [[shimakaze_(azur_lane)]]
* [b]Character Variations[/b]: [[hakurei_reimu]] vs. [[hakurei_reimu_(pc-98)]] (two designs for Hakurei Reimu)
* [b]Diegesis[/b]: [[photo (medium)]] vs. [[photo_(object)]] 
* [b]Tag Meanings[/b]: [[panty]] vs. [[panty_(psg)]] (underwear vs. Anarchy Panty), [[araki_hirohiko]] vs [[araki_hirohiko_(style)]] (artist vs. artist's style)

While in most cases one qualifier is sufficient, some Tags may have two or more qualifiers.
* [b]Cosplay of a Character:[/b] [[shimakaze (kancolle) (cosplay)]]


h6. Metatags 
You can search and filter Posts by criteria not covered by conventional tags, such as score, source, image pixel size and status. Some metatags are keywords that map to a Post's properties and are a powerful search tool when used properly. There is also the [i]order[/i] metatag which controls how Posts are sorted in a listing.

Try these searches:
* [b]Post with closely related posts[/b]: {{parent:any}}
* [b]No sex, please![/b] {{is:sfw}}
* [b]Group shots of more than 10 characters[/b]: {{chartags:>10}}
* [b]Artist Collaborations[/b]: {{arttags:>1}}
* [b]Worst Posts Countdown[/b]: {{order:score status:flagged}}

The full list of metatags can be found in the [[help:cheatsheet|Search Cheatsheet]].

A two tag restriction limits the power of metatag searches. If you use metatags a lot, an upgraded account is recommended. For information on how to upgrade, see the information at the end of this guide.

h6. Image Search with iqdb

Danbooru has been intergrated with "iqdb's image search":http://iqdb.org, so you can track down a tagged copy from our Post gallery with just a picture. The search engine accepts images from your computer's local storage or from another location with a URL.

Here's a few good uses of iqdb image search:
* When you find a random picture from the internet that turns you on, but you don't know what character is depicted, or who the artist is. 
* When you have only a thumbnail or a low quality copy, and you want to find a higher quality version of the picture.
* When you need to find a clean copy of a watermarked image.

However, there are limitations:
* If you want to search an image in a motivator or collage, crop away the motivator or separate the image from the collage first.
* The search engine at iqdb has its filesize limits.
* Danbooru's content is highly moderated, and we won't have every picture in the world! If you are lucky, you may find the picture other sites linked with iqdb.

Try an iqdb search:

* Go to your favorite forum or any other place where random anime art is posted a lot. If you can't think of a good place to start, try "4chan's Ecchi board":http://boards.4chan.org/e/.
* Copy the URL of a [i]thumbnail[/i] or download it, if safe to do so.
* Paste the URL into the Search URL box at "iqdb":http://iqdb.org. If you downloaded the thumbnail, click on the File box instead and locate your thumbnail.
* If iqdb manages to find a match, you will get a list of thumbnails and links to the sites that have a copy. Is the picture available on Danbooru? If it isn't, is it available on another site?
* When a match cannot be found, you might get seemingly random results. If you are geeky enough, can you figure out how iqdb works?

h4. Browsing Pools

Pools are ordered collections of Posts. Our most common use for Pools are:

* Keeping track of Posts that belong to a miniseries (such as a specific doujinshi volume).
* Grouping Posts by copyrights that does not yet have a tag.
* Grouping Posts by themes that are difficult or impossible to tag.

h6. Pool Search and Listing
The Pool listing and search can be accessed by choosing "Pools":/pools at the top of the page from anywhere on Danbooru.
* If you don't perform a search, you will be shown a listing of recently updated Pools.
* Pool searches behave more like standard search engines and the tag  autocomplete. Unlike the Tag search, you do not need to manually place your wildcards.
* [b]Purple[/b] Pools are Series Pools containing Posts meant to be read in order. These are usually multi-page [[comic|manga]], or an ordered series of one-page works.
* [b]Blue[/b] Pools are Collection Pools used to keep Posts of a theme that doesn't yet or cannot have a tag.

h6. Browsing a Pool
You can start browsing a Pool by selecting a Pool from the listing. You will be presented a Post listing and an optional description for the Pool. If you want to browse a Pool in order, begin by opening the top-leftmost Post in the first page of the Pool.

When viewing a Post that belongs to a Pool, there will be additional controls below the image and before the comments to allow you to navigate the Pool or return to its Post listing.

You will soon notice that some Posts can belong to more than one Pool. There will be controls for each Pool the Post belongs to. If you feel tempted to take a detour and browse another Pool, you are by all means welcome to, but don't get lost!

While you are at it, why not have a browse in some of Danbooru's classic Pools: 

* Badass (pool #1277)
* Clever (pool #330)
* Disgustingly Adorable (pool #903)
* Fund It! (pool #1636)
* Stupidly Clever (pool #3545)

Danbooru also maintains a list of featured pools in the [[Pool Groups]].

h6. Filtering (performing a Post search within a Pool)
You can filter out Posts in a Pool by means of a metatag search, and knowledge of the Pool's id (number). To find out the Pool id, navigate to the top view of the Pool where you see the Post listing. Pay attention to the URL your browser is pointing at. It should look like this:

* https://danbooru.donmai.us/pools/903

Where 903 will be substituted for the id of the Pool you are browsing. Copy down this number, and go to the Posts view to perform your Pool filter or search. Simply add the metatag to your search:

* {{pool:903}}

Substituting 903 for the id of the Pool you are searching. You're already searching within a Pool!

h4. Accounts, Favorites and Blacklists

h6. Features that Require an Account
Signing up for a new account is required to use some of Danbooru's other features, such as view options, favorites and blacklists. All new registrations create a basic restricted Member account, which you can upgrade for benefits such as expanded search capabilities. An account is also a starting point for lurkers to become future contributors.

h6. Before Signing Up (Your Privacy Matters!)
Danbooru is not insulated from search engines that crawl the web. In short, [i]everything[/i] you do on Danbooru will be known to the rest of the world that has access to an (uncensored) internet connection and a web browser. This includes your favorites, and everything that you post should you become a contributor in the future. 

In other words, if you have a life to lose by having your identity associated with anime-style art and doujinshi, make up a fake name and use it!

To create an account right now, scroll up to the top of the page, and follow the [i]"sign up for a free basic account":[/users/new/][/i] link.

h6. View Options with an Account

When viewing Posts with an account, the following options become available:

[b]Resize to Window[/b]
* Toggles between viewing the image of the Post at full size, and resizing it to fit the [i]width[/i] of the browser's display area.

[b]Favorite/Unfavorite[/b]
* Adds the Post to your favorites.
* When the post has been already added, the [i]Unfavorite[/i] option, which removes the Post from your favorites, appears in its place. 
* Favorites are described in greater in the next section below.

[b]Find Similar[/b]
* Submits the Post to "iqdb":http://iqdb.org/ image search in order to find similar-looking posts on Danbooru or a selection of other similar sites.

[b]User settings[/b]
* With account available change various [[help:user_settings|settings]].

h6. Favorites
Every account comes with a personal pool called Favorites. You are allowed to add any post that you like into your favorites. Use it like collection of bookmarks or links to posts that turn you on. Any user can have any number of favorites, so feel free to favorite as much as you like.

You can view your favorites by going to your Account profile (select My Account from the top of the page), and then scrolling down to the Post mini-listing at the bottom. Follow the link named Favorites.

For those who love URLs, your Favorites can be accessed at (while Signed In):

* https://danbooru.donmai.us/favorites

Favorites do not show up under a Pool search, but you can view another Danbooru User's favorites through their profile page (you can also access this by clicking on their username), or with a metatag search:

* [b]albert's favorites, by score[/b]: {{fav:albert order:score}}

h6. Blacklists

You can block out Posts based on their tags. This provides a way of hiding posts containing content that you don't like to see. To blacklist content, open up the settings view by going to [i]My Account[/i], and then to [i]Basic Settings[/i]. Scroll down to the bottom.

There will be a box labelled [i]Blacklisted tags[/i]. This is how it works:

* Each line contains a list of tags separated by spaces. This will be a single blacklist [b]criterion[/b].
* Start a new list of tags on a new line (with Enter/Return).
* Posts that contain every tag in a single line will be hidden from view.

Let's try an example blacklist. Enter this into the Blacklisted tags box, remembering to start a new line with enter/return:
[quote]
touhou
blonde_hair long_hair breasts
-rating:s,g
[/quote]

* Go searching or browsing Posts. You may find that the Post listing is a little more empty than before. This is the tag blacklist in action.
* Look around. What do you notice missing?
* There will be a new group of options on the left side of the Post listing view labelled [i]Blacklisted[/i]. It's the very same tags that you entered into the blacklist box.
* Click on each of the blacklist criteria to reveal the blacklisted Posts. You will need to toggle each blacklist criterion separately.

Here is what the blacklist did:
* [[touhou]] : Blocks out Posts with references to the [[touhou|Touhou Project]]. Everyone's beloved youkai girls disappear.
* {{blonde_hair long_hair breasts}} : Blocks out Posts containing all blondes, long hair and breasts at the same time. Notice that you still can see breast glamor shots of long-haired models that aren't blonde, and breast glamor shots of blonde models with short hair, and pictures of long-haired blondes that don't focus on breasts.
* {{-rating:s,g}} : Blocks out posts that are not rated either sensitive or general. This is similar to browsing on "Donmai.moe":[https://donmai.moe]. In Danbooruspeak, this is a negation blacklist on a metatag.

Some posts may require you to turn off more than one blacklist criteria before you can see them.

[quote]
[b]Privacy (and Purity) Note[/b]

Blacklists simply hide the Post, but the post thumbnail is still downloaded to your system. You may want to read up on web browser privacy if you are really concerned about Danbooru content on your system.

[/quote]

To reverse these changes, go back to [i]My Account[/i] and then [i]Settings[/i], scroll down and remove everything you typed into the blacklist box.

Please be aware that blacklisting based on metatags and negation isn't fully supported yet. Some negations and metatag combinations will not work properly. You may not be able to filter posts by score and favcount, for example.

h4. Upgrade Now!
[tn]Paid account upgrades are not currently functional.[/tn]
h6. Benefits of Upgrading
Think you've had all Danbooru had to offer? We don't think so! If you frequent our site and love the content, why not upgrade to a Gold account? You will be sure to benefit from an upgrade if you need these features:

[b]Keeps Danbooru Running[/b]
Consider your upgrade a donation to help us keep Danbooru on the internet. Just like any other site, there are servers to maintain. And we have to pay for our hostname, and for every byte downloaded from us!

[b]Expanded Search Capabilities[/b]
Search with 6 tags with a Gold account, 12 with a Platinum. The increased tag limit dramatically increases your ability to search our Posts. Freely use metatags and detailed tag queries. 
Your timeout will be increased to 6 seconds (9 seconds for Platinum), allowing for more complex searches with ordering.
[tn]Paid Platinum upgrades are discontinued; it can be obtained via raffle.[/tn]

[b]More Viewing Features[/b]
Is twenty Posts per page in listing view enough for you? If you say no, an upgrade lets you set the number of Posts per page. Turn it up to 50 or a hundred!  You can also add tags to your search without retyping.

h6. Go to "the Upgrade page":/user_upgrades/new to upgrade your account now.

There are more upgrade options for contributors who have significantly helped with the upkeeping of Danbooru. For a full description on every upgrade level available on Danbooru, see the [[help:users|User Levels]] Wiki.

h4. See Also

* [[howto:contribute|Contributor Guide (Read before posting anything!)]]

h4. Go Back

* "Return to Information for Lurkers and New Users":/wiki_pages/help:toc.html#dtext-information_for_lurkers_and_new_users
* "Return to the Table of Contents":/help/toc
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":/help/home

title: bronya_zaychik_(valkyrie_chariot)
body:
The initial costume and playable version of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Bronya Zaychik]] when you start the game. 

It consists of a [[double-breasted]] [[blue shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and [[aiguillette]]s, [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], [[vertical-striped shirt]] underneath, [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[red thighhighs]] under [[white thighhighs|white]] ones, and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #3331461

title: kiana_kaslana_(white_comet)
body:
The default costume of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Kiana Kaslana]] when you start the game. 

It consists of a [[star print]] [[white bodysuit]] with a [[center opening]] for her chest, and a [[black hairband|black]] [[cat ear hairband]] (can also have stars instead of cat ears); with optional [[head-mounted display]] and a [[white jacket]] with [[orange jacket|orange-colored]] [[long sleeves]]. Worth noting is that it also comes with a "Neko" and star-themed burst activation. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #5355805: Bodysuit
* !post #6112790: With jacket

title: tooka_(oqv64f2wtpjjgrp)
body: Posts [[AI-generated]] content, do not upload.

title: ice_cream_float
body:
A drink consisting of 1-2 scoops of [[ice cream]] (usually vanilla) mixed with cola, root beer, or other soda beverages.

In Japanese the term "cream soda" is used to refer to an ice cream float consisting of melon soda topped with vanilla ice cream, while in North America the term "cream soda" refers to a vanilla flavored soft drink based on the taste of an ice cream float.

h4.See also

* [[Cream soda]]
* [[Melon soda]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ice cream float":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ice_cream_float]

title: cream_soda
body: A [[soda]] with flavor based on [[ice cream float]]. Not to be confused with the ice cream float itself.

title: wooden_spoon
body:
A type of [[spoon]] made of wood. Generally more utilized in food preparation than in consumption.

Disposable flat bowl ice cream spoon can also be made from wood and this tag should also apply.

h4. See also

* [[disposable spoon]]
* [[ice cream spoon]]
* [[wooden ladle]]

title: disposable_spoon
body:
Small and disposable spoon made from plastic or wood. Usually used to eat [[ice cream]].

h4. See Also
* [[ice cream spoon]]
* [[plastic spoon]]
* [[wooden spoon]]

title: plastic_spoon
body:
A [[spoon]] made from plastic.

h4. See Also
* [[ice cream spoon]]

title: stirring_rod
body:
A rod for [[stirring]] liquids in something like a [[cauldron]]. If it's small and used to stir drinks in a [[cup]] or [[drinking glass]] then tag [[stirrer]] instead. If it's made from glass and used in laboratory setting then tag [[glass stirring rod]] instead.

h4. See Also
* [[glass stirring rod]]
* [[stirrer]]

title: stirrer
body:
A thin stick or rod used to [[stirring|stir]] drinks, usually [[coffee]], [[cocktail]]s and traditionally prepared sodas like [[melon soda]] and [[ice cream float]]s.

It usually has a small ball at the top to act as a counterweight and may sometimes have a also have small [[spoon]] at the bottom to increase its effectiveness.

If the rod is bigger and not used for drinks in a [[cup]] or [[drinking glass]] then tag [[stirring rod]] instead. If it's made from glass and used to mix chemical in a laboratory, use [[glass stirring rod]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[bar spoon]]
* [[ice cream spoon]]
* [[stirring rod]]
* [[glass stirring rod]]

title: glass_stirring_rod
body:
A glass rod used as a laboratory equipment to [[stirring|stir]] and mix chemicals. They are usually made of solid glass, about the thickness and slightly longer than a drinking straw. Can have rounded end.

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glass_rod

h4. See Also
* [[stirrer]]
* [[stirring rod]]

title: cross_calibur_(fate)
body:
[[Mysterious Heroine X Alter (Fate)|]]'s weapon. It is often seen resembling a [[red lightsaber|red]] [[double bladed lightsaber]], but originally took a form resembling a [[glowing sword|glowing red]] [[energy sword]] variant of [[Himitsucalibur (Fate)|]] and by extension [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]] with red markings on its [[hilt]]. It can also transform into a [[chainsaw]].

Similarly to [[Himitsucalibur (fate)|]], if its portrayed in its original form without the [[glowing sword|glowing]] element, it may simply be tagged as [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[Excalibur Morgan (fate)|]]
* [[Himitsucalibur (fate)|]]
* [[Lumino Calibur (fate)|]], [[Mysterious Idol X Alter (fate)|]]'s weapon

title: himitsucalibur_(fate)
body:
[b]Unsigned Sword of Victory[/b]

The two swords wielded by [[Mysterious Heroine X (fate)|]]. They resemble [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]] and [[Excalibur Morgan (fate)|]], but can [[glowing sword|glow]] like a [[lightsaber]]. They take on more futuristic appearances in her [[Mysterious Heroine X (third ascension) (fate)|third ascension]].

For tagging purposes, these should only be tagged as Himitsucalibur when visibly glowing or in their third ascension forms. Otherwise they can be tagged with their regular versions, [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]] and [[Excalibur Morgan (fate)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[Cross Calibur (fate)|]], [[Mysterious Heroine X Alter (fate)|]]'s weapon
* [[Twinmyniad (fate)|]], [[Mysterious Heroine XX (fate)|]]'s weapon

title: golden_diva
body:
Boss of the Golden Passage and the final boss of [i][[Wario Land 4]][/i]. An ugly, extravagant ghost woman who covers her face in [[kabuki]] [[noh mask|okame masks]] and proudly wears the stolen jewelry of [[Princess Shokora]]. 

She is the one that took over the Golden Pyramid and cursed the ruins due to her greed, making Princess Shokora lose her original form in the process.

title: meica_(vtuber)_(1st_costume)
body:
The current costume of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie VTuber]] [[Meica (vtuber)|]], as seen in post #6372753. Illustrated by [[Kisaragi Yuri]].

She wears a [[green dress]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[juliet sleeves]] and a [[black capelet|black]] [[half capelet]], layered over a white [[single-shoulder shirt]] which has a [[see-through shirt|see-through]] midriff, [[sleeveless shirt|no sleeves]] and is fastened by a [[chest belt]]. She also wears [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] with [[cross-laced_shorts|side lacing]] and [[o-ring thigh strap]]. Her legwear is [[uneven legwear|uneven]] and consists of a [[single thighhigh]] and a [[single over-kneehigh]], both with a [[black thighhighs|black]] and [[green thighhighs|green]] [[gradient legwear|gradient]] color and [[sparkle print|sparkle prints]]. Lastly, the outfit has [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]]. Her accessories are a [[compass]], a [[black choker]] with a [[sprout pendant]] and a [[bow (weapon)|bow]].

title: catbat_(wario_land)
body: Boss of the Sapphire Passage in [i][[Wario Land 4]][/i]. A ghostly, grotesque [[cat]] and [[bat]] hybrid with a [[open_mouth|large mouth]] and [[long tongue]].

title: aerodent
body: Boss of the Topaz Passage in [i][[Wario Land 4]][/i]. A ghostly [[mouse_(animal)|rodent]] that inflates and hides behind a giant [[teddy bear]].

title: spoiled_rotten
body:
Boss of the Entry Passage in [i][[Wario Land 4]][/i]. A large, round pink eggplant creature that carries a [[doll]].

Notable for being the only boss in the game that is not a ghostly entity, doesn't contain any of the Golden Pyramid's treasures and doesn't revive after you beat the game.

title: cractus
body:
Boss of the Emerald Passage in [i][[Wario Land 4]][/i]. A giant, drooling ghostly plant that resembles a [[venus flytrap]].

Another Cractus appears in [i][[WarioWare: Move It!]][/i]  during [[Kat_(warioware)|Kat]] & [[Ana_(warioware)|Ana]]'s story. This Cractus has a slightly different design, with much more protruding leaves around it's head, lacking spikes on arm-leaves, no longer having visible white sharp teeth and due to no longer being a ghost is firmly planted in the ground with no ability to float. This Cractus also commands a legion of lesser plant appendages that also have eyes and mouths. 

While the Cractus in [i]Wario Land 4[/i] is named [b]Furawana[/b] (ãƒ•ãƒ©ãƒ¯ãƒŠ) in japanese, the Cractus' name in [i]WarioWare: Move It![/i] is slightly different, being named [b]Furawani[/b] (ãƒ•ãƒ©ãƒ¯ãƒ‹)

title: roman_sionis
body: Black Mask (Roman Sionis) is a supervillain appearing in comic books published by [[DC Comics]]. Created by Doug Moench and Tom Mandrake, the character debuted in [[Batman]] #386 (August 1985).He is commonly depicted as a brutal and ruthless crime lord in Gotham City who has a fixation with masks and derives sadistic pleasure from the act of torture. Black Mask is one of the most enduring enemies of the superhero Batman and belongs to the collective of adversaries that make up his rogues gallery.

title: gm_iii
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

[b]RGM-86R GM III[/b]

The final mass-produced refit of the venerable (but aging and underperforming) [[gm_(mobile_suit)|GM]] [[mobile suit]] series. It was first deployed during The First [[Neo Zeon]] War. Used by the [[Earth Federation]], its [[earth_federation_space_forces|EFSF]] branch (both in red and white/blue and white colors) and the [[aeug|AEUG/Karaba]] (in green and white colors). 

While its outside appearance is mostly the same, it's faster, has better electronics, can be equipped with [[missile pod]]s and possesses reinforced armor in select parts. Distinguishable by the pair of [[radio antenna]]s on its head unit, resembling the [[Ideon]].

Preceded by the [[GM II]] and succeeded by the [[Jegan]].

h4. Related development
* [[GM III Powered]]

title: garchomp
body:
[[pokemon|PokÃ©mon]] #445 in the National PokÃ©Dex, a dual type Dragon/Ground PokÃ©mon.
Garchomp is a bipedal, draconian PokÃ©mon that is primarily dark blue in color. It has red on its underbelly from the lower jaw to the middle of the abdomen, including the undersides of its arms. Notable for being the signature PokÃ©mon of [[Cynthia (Pokemon)|]].

It evolves from [[Gabite]] and can [i][[mega pokemon|mega evolve]][/i] into [[Mega Garchomp]] using the [i]Garchompite[/i].

title: shigure_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)

The kai form/retrofit for [[Shigure (azur lane)|]] from [[Azur Lane]].

In her retrofit, her crop top becomes a single piece of cloth held by white straps wrapping around her back. She gains a black [[overskirt]] in addition to her white one. She gets some white [[detached sleeves]] with red cuffs and black [[fingerless gloves]]. On her legs are now [[black thighhighs]] and [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[high heels]].

Her rigging gains two [[single mechanical arm|mechanical arms]], as well as more extraneous metal.

title: bryan_cranston
body:
Bryan Lee Cranston (born March 7, 1956) is an American actor. He is best known for portraying [[Walter White]] in the AMC crime drama series [[Breaking Bad]] (2008â€“2013) and Hal in the Fox sitcom [[Malcolm in the Middle]] (2000â€“2006). He has received a number of awards, including six Primetime Emmy Awards, two Tony Awards, and two Golden Globes, in addition to nominations for an Academy Award and a BAFTA Award.
Cranston's voice acting includes English dubbing of anime (for which he primarily used the non-union pseudonym Lee Stone), including [[Macross Plus]] and [[armitage iii|Armitage III: Poly-Matrix]] and most notably [[Street Fighter II: The Animated Movie]] as [[Fei Long]].

title: malcolm_in_the_middle
body:
Malcolm in the Middle is an American television sitcom created by Linwood Boomer for the Fox Broadcasting Company. The series premiered on January 9, 2000, and ended on May 14, 2006, after seven seasons consisting of 151 episodes.
The single-camera series is a family black comedy that follows a dysfunctional working class family and stars Frankie Muniz in the lead role as Malcolm, a child prodigy. The ensemble cast includes Jane Kaczmarek and [[Bryan Cranston]] as Malcolm's parents, Lois and Hal. Christopher Kennedy Masterson, Justin Berfield, and Erik Per Sullivan appear as Malcolm's brothers, Francis, Reese, and Dewey, respectively. Typical plots revolve around the family's dysfunctional relationships and inability to fit into society, with Malcolm regularly making asides to the camera to comment on their failures. Another brother, Jamie (James and Lukas Rodriguez), was introduced as the fifth son of Hal and Lois at the end of season four. The show was notable for its pop punk influences and portrayal of 2000s youth culture.

title: walter_white
body:
The main protagonist of [[Breaking Bad]].

Also known as "[b]Heisenberg[/b]" in honor of the late "Werner Heisenberg":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Werner_Heisenberg], White is a skilled chemist who could barely support his family. After being diagnosed with lung cancer, Walter became a drug dealer alongside with his former student, [[Jesse Pinkman]].

Portrayed by [[Bryan Cranston]].

title: israel-hamas_war
body:
A [[war]] primarily between [[Israel]] and Hamas militants and allies centred around the [[gaza|Gaza Strip]], [[Palestine]] that began on October 7th, 2023, with Hamas' attack on Israeli settlements and military outposts surroundng the Gaza Strip. Israel accused Hamas of indiscriminately killings civilians in order to justify a full scale invasion of the Gaza Strip to "neutralize Hamas once and for all".

The war quickly devolved into a full-scale invasion of the Gaza Strip by the [[Israel Defense Forces]], with multiple cases of scorched earth tactics used by the IDF, levelling Palestinian settlements and starving the population (a charge Israel denies, often claiming their attacks are "precision strikes" against Hamas), along with various claims and evidence of atrocities committed by the IDF. This led to call for ceasefire and support for Palestine around the world.

The war has also spilled over into various other Middle Eastern countries, particularly countries under the influence of [[Iran]] such as [[Syria]], [[Lebanon]], and the Houthi-controlled areas of [[Yemen]], while Israel receives military and political support from the [[United States]] and NATO, which led some analysts to consider the war a proxy conflict between the US and Iran.

The conflict has brought the overall Israel-Palestine conflict into the public forefront, and has been a divisive topic that has been both defended and condemned to the most extreme extent. Supporters of Palestine often condemn the war as an example of "continued European colonization" and of genocidal oppression, while supporters of Israel argue that Israel has the right to "defend themselves" against hostile forces, regardless of the ways in which this is achieved.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:history]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93Hamas_war]

He is always in a [[tailcoat]] and/or [[vest]] (with [[wing collar]] and [[bowtie]]), along with [[top hat]] and [[cane]]. title: neko_no_ongaeshi
body:
A [[Studio Ghibli]] movie about a girl who accidentally ends up entangled in a plot to make her the bride of the prince of the Cat Kingdom after she unknowingly rescues him from a truck. The longer she stays in the kingdom, the more cat-like she becomes. Several other characters help her along the way, most notably [[the baron (mimi wo sumaseba)|Baron]] and [[Muta (neko no ongaeshi)|]].

It is an influential work in the [[furry]] genre in Japan.

Real Name: Eureka

Also known as Streamer U, an energetic yet clumsy girl who formerly work as a TV host for BolÃ­var's national television station.
After many disastrous events, she has decided to become a streamer, and work with Rhodes Island under [[Click_(arknights)|]]'s recommendation.

She previously appeared outside of the game as a TV hostess promoting upcoming in-universe events, which would inevitably end up in disasters.
Her fame as ""walking catastrophe":https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FbwX6feXkAAj-SY?format=jpg&name=large" got set in stone after the 2022 [[Ambience Synesthesia]] concert: After appearing as in-universe newscaster publicizing the event, 
in real life sudden covid restrictions resulted in the concert being canceled.
She then appeared as operator and protagonist of the 2023 april fools event on CN servers. Outside servers had to wait until 2024, though.

Her motif is based on the [[hamster]]s. 

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Takada Yuuki]] (JP), Xiao Zheng (CN), [[LilyPichu]] (EN), and Bang Si-woo (KR).

title: drake_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

She is a member of [[Matis (Nikke)|]] along with [[laplace (nikke)|Laplace]] and [[maxwell (nikke)|Maxwell]], Drake often presents herself as a villain among the three, however this often puts her in unfortunate situations such as inadvertently doing good deeds. Aside from her villain-like motif, Drake is often presented as a naive and airheaded Nikke, much to [[Maxwell (nikke)|]]'s dismay.

Like other members of Matis, Drake is named after a famous scientist, namely the late astronomer [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Drake](Frank Drake), who is known for the Drake equation.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] which has a [[hairclip]] attached on it. She has [[small breasts]]. She wears [[earrings]] She wears a [[black leotard]] clad in [[armor|red armor]], [[armored glove]], and [[armored boots]], usually seen with a [[off shoulder]] [[red cape]]. During combat, Drake conjures a [[headgear]]//[[mask]]. Her usual demeanor shows her [[grin|grinning]] or [[evil grin|evil grinning]].

title: reference_photo
body:
A [[photo (medium)|]] that has been used as a reference by an artist when creating an art piece. The result of using such references can range from detailed recreations of the photographs to simple copied poses, expressions, or situations.

[b]This tag is for the photos themselves[/b], not for images based on reference photos. Use when the post is wholly the reference material. If the reference photo is displayed alongside the referencing photo, use [[reference inset]] and [[photo inset]] instead.

Not to be confused with photos used in [[photo background]]s, which are not used as referenced to create the actual art piece.

h4. Example

* !asset #20076336: [b][[Reference photo]][/b]
* !post #7315357: [[Photo-referenced]]

h4. See also

* [[photo-referenced]]

The first Nikke which the [[Commander (nikke)|]] encounters. Despite being the first playable Nikke in the game's tutorial, she is not unlockable as a playable character.

She has [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]]. She wears a [[blue headwear|white]] [[garrison cap]], [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon]], [[collared shirt|collared]] [[sleeveless shirt]], [[black pantyhose]], [[blue sleeves|blue]] [[detached sleeves]], [[black gloves]], [[blue necktie]], [[brown belt]], and [[black footwear]]. 

[spoiler]After Marian is corrupted by the Raptures, the Commander has to euthanize her, with her last words thanking them for a bandage. It is later revealed that [[Modernia (Nikke)|]] is her new reincarnation.[/spoiler]

The [[commander (nikke)|]] would later discover that Enikk and Chatterbox had made a deal: the Raptures would not attack the Ark in exchange for a regular sacrifice of Nikkes to be used as servants for the Rapture Queen, [spoiler]with Marian being the latest and last Nikke to be offered.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Do not use this tag with [[Modernia (nikke)|]] unless both forms are present, as Modernia is specifically for Marian's new form.[/spoiler]

Illustrator: [[KKUEM]]

A long appendage protruding from the lower back. Often covered in fur or scales. A common feature of animal girls.

In general, don't tag this on an [[animal]] unless there's something special or noteworthy about the tail, such as one of the many tags below that implicate this tag like [[heart tail]] or [[holding with tail]], or if the image is focused on the tail. Definitely don't tag an animal with a tail of its own type, like tagging [[cat tail]] on a [[cat]]. (Do tag weird combos like a [[rabbit tail]] on a [[cat]], though.)

title: star_wars:_the_clone_wars_(movie)
body:
Star Wars: The Clone Wars is a 2008 American animated space opera film directed by Dave Filoni, produced by Lucasfilm Ltd. and Lucasfilm Animation, and distributed by Warner Bros. Pictures, becoming the first [[Star Wars]] film to not be distributed by [[20th century studios|20th Century Fox]]. It is the first fully animated film in the Star Wars franchise and takes place shortly after [[star wars: attack of the clones|Episode II â€“ Attack of the Clones]] (2002), at the start of the titular Clone Wars. In the film, [[Count Dooku]] and Jabba the Hutt's uncle Ziro orchestrate a plan to turn Jabba against the Galactic Republic by framing the [[Jedi]] for the kidnapping of his son. While [[Anakin Skywalker]] and his newly assigned apprentice [[Ahsoka Tano]] attempt to deliver the child back to his father, [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Padme Amidala]] lead separate investigations to uncover Dooku and Ziro's plot.
The film serves as a pilot episode to the television [[star wars: the clone wars|series of the same name]], which premiered on [[Cartoon Network]] two months after the film's release.

title: rotta_the_hutt
body: Rotta, is a [[Star Wars]] character, he was a male Hutt and the son of [[Jabba the Hutt]]. During the Clone Wars, he was secretly kidnapped by the Confederacy of Independent Systems, which was orchestrated by [[Count Dooku]] with help from Ziro, Rotta's great-uncle. The plot was meant to discredit the [[jedi|Jedi Order]] and scuttle negotiations between the Galactic Republic and the Hutts, but the Jedi were able to rescue him. He was kidnapped by Asajj Ventress and taken to the planet Teth. A Jedi rescue team consisting of [[Anakin Skywalker]] and his Padawan [[Ahsoka Tano]] traveled to Teth to rescue him. He then became sick and nearly died on his way to Tatooine but survived thanks to Ahsoka Tano. After Anakin Skywalker and Tano evaded Dooku, who tried to kill Rotta and blame the Jedi, Rotta was returned to his father. Rotta was later present when Baron Notluwiski Papanoida visited Jabba's Palace. In 20 BBY, Ventress returned to [[Tatooine]], and wished to avoid attention from Jabba as she had previously kidnapped his son.

title: tacet_mark_(wuthering_waves)
body:
Special [[body markings]] found on all [[Wuthering Waves]] Resonators and throughout SOL3 (the game's world). All Resonators can channel power through their Tacet Mark to exhibit a power called a Forte. The release design of Tacet Marks resemble a sound wave diagram in line with the game's focus on sound-related themes, whereas its original design looked closer to a stretched-out star.

Note that Tacet Marks can vary in their activation state, appearance and location on a character's body but keep the same basic structure. Visit each character's individual wiki for more information on where to find their specific Tacet Marks.

[b]Note:[/b] [[Shorekeeper (wuthering Waves)|]] sets a precedent where some playable resonators may [i]not[/i] have a Tacet Mark. Only tag Tacet Mark on characters that show the current design or confirm with the character tag wiki for information on the location, if applicable, of a Tacet Mark.

h4. Examples

* !asset #20831947: Tacet Mark
* !post #7794195: Active Tacet Mark running down [[Jinhsi (Wuthering Waves)|]]'s back.
* !post #7595024: Inactive Tacet Mark on [[Male Rover (Wuthering Waves)|]]'s right hand.
* !post #7916341: [[Sanhua (Wuthering Waves)|]]'s right iris and pupil are a Tacet Mark.
* !post #8102708: [[Xiangli Yao]]'s Tacet Mark is just below his right shoulder.

She was later granted leadership over the Black Shores and served as a key to the Tethys System's computations which guided the Black Shores' future activities.[/spoiler]

title: rick_sanchez
body:
Titular character in [[Rick and Morty]].

The smartest man in the multiverse and depressed alcoholic. Grandfather of [[Morty Smith]] and [[Summer Smith]], father of [[Beth Smith]] and father-in-law of [[Jerry Smith]].

There are multiple versions of this character from different universes in the series. This tag can be used when any one of them is portrayed.

Rick was originally voiced by [[justin Roiland (person)|Justin Roiland]] from Season 1 to 6 but was later replaced by Ian Cardoni starting Season 7 due to Roiland being fired due to domestic abuses charges and his increasing unprofessional behavior at work.
H4.Alternative versions of Rick
* [[Pickle Rick]]
* [[Rick Prime]]

title: rick_prime
body:
Sanchez of the Prime Dimension, also known as Rick Prime, is the overarching antagonist of [[Rick and Morty]], as well as the catalyst for the events of the series.

He was the [[rick sanchez|Rick]] who was responsible for the deaths of Diane in every single dimension and Beth Sanchez in Dimension C-137.
Rick C-137 attempted to find and kill Rick Prime throughout the multiverse for decades, killing countless other Ricks in the process. Rick eventually landed in Rick Prime's original dimension and took his place, kickstarting the events of the series.

title: sitting
body:
The butt resting on a surface (often a [[chair]], [[couch]], or [[bench]]), possibly in addition to the legs or feet. For a position with the knees on the floor, use [[kneeling]] (except with seiza below).

h4. Examples

* !post #3279793: (left to right: [[yokozuwari]], [[butterfly sitting]], [[wariza]], [[hugging own legs]])
* !post #2866134: (left to right: [[indian style]], [[seiza]], [[knees up]], [[wariza]], [i]hidden[/i], [[crossed ankles]])

h4. Related tags

h6. Positions

* [[Butterfly sitting]]: Rump on floor, knees splayed, soles of feet joined together.
* [[Crossed legs]]: Rump on chair, one leg on top of the other at the knee.
* [[Figure four sitting]]: in a chair, the ankle or calf of one leg resting on the knee of the other.
* [[Indian style]]: Rump on floor, legs crossed at the ankles like a pretzel.
* [[Lotus position]]: like Indian style, but with feet placed on opposite thighs with soles facing upward and heels close to the abdomen.
* [[Seiza]]: Rump on legs, both legs below body.
* [[Sitting backwards]]: in a chair, facing the backrest.
* [[Sitting sideways]]: in a chair, facing the side.
* [[Wariza]]: Rump on floor, legs bent back on either side.
* [[Yokozuwari]]: Rump on floor, legs both to the same side.

h6. Other sitting tags

* [[Invisible chair]] (sitting on air)

Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. She is [[invisible]] due to her quirk, which allows her body to refract and redirect light. However, her clothes remain visible, as her quirk only affects her actual body.

Her likeness was finally revealed when she was shown [[unusually visible]] in an illustration (post #6220990) drawn for the series' 34th volume, depicting her with [[messy hair|messy]] [[green hair]] and [[thick eyelashes]]. title: jiro_kyoka
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]].

A student in Class 1-A. Outspoken, snarky, and typically unenthusiastic, Jirou also has an interest in rock music (something sheâ€™s actually quite embarrassed about).

She has [[short hair|short]], indigo [[blue hair]] and [[black eyes]]. She sometimes wears red [[facial mark|facial marks]]. She has [[long earlobes]] shaped like [[audio jack]]s. There is a highlight on her hair that resembles the trace of a sound wave.

Her quirk is "earphone jack", which grants her the unique "earlobe jacks" that she can extend at will. She can plug the earlobe jack onto any surface to increase her sound reception from the distance, as well as using it to "amplify" her heartbeat to create an earthquake-like shockwave.

Her mother is [[Jirou Mika]].

title: aoyama_yuga
body:
Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i].

A student in Class 1-A. His Quirk gives him the ability to shoot lasers from his navel, though shooting for more than a second gives him stomach problems. A very flashy and narcissistic boy.

He has [[parted bangs|parted]] [[blonde hair|blond hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. He likes to [[sparkle]]. His hero costume resembles [[armor]].

title: tetsutetsu_tetsutetsu
body:
Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i].

A student in Class 1-B. A hot-blooded student with a hardening Quirk, much like his friendly rival [[Kirishima Eijiro]].

title: kirishima_eijiro
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. A passionate young man who often brings up the concept of manliness, and admires tough guys. Often seen with [[Bakugou Katsuki]] and is one of the only students who tries to get along with him.

His Quirk allows him to harden his body, making it tough and rock-like.

He has [[red eyes]], [[spiked_hair|spiked]] [[red hair]] and [[sharp teeth]].

title: yaoyorozu_momo
body:
A character from Class 1-A in [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i]. She is the class vice president alongside [[Iida Tenya]]. 

She is one of two students chosen to attend U.A. via recommendations. Intelligent and polite, Momo is seen as a natural leader, although she is prone to losing confidence, especially when comparing herself to [[Todoroki Shoto]].

Her quirk gives her the ability to make anything she has knowledge of using her body.

She has [[black hair]] [[hair_pulled_back|pulled back]]  in a [[ponytail]], and [[large breasts]]. Her hero costume is a red [[bodysuit]] with a [[center opening]], exposing her [[midriff]] and [[cleavage]] (in order to make more surface area available for creating large objects).

title: todoroki_rei
body: Character in [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. Wife of [[Endeavor (boku No Hero Academia)|Enji]], and the mother of [[Todoroki Shoto|Shouto]], [[Todoroki Natsuo|Natsuo]], [[Todoroki Fuyumi|Fuyumi]], and [[Todoroki Touya|Touya]].

title: endeavor_(boku_no_hero_academia)
body:
Pro hero from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i], the [[mature male|father]] of [[Todoroki Shoto]]. His [[beard]] and clothing appear to be on [[fire]].

His real name is Todoroki Enji.
Often with the hero [[Hawks (boku no hero academia)|]].

title: todoroki_shoto
body:
Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i].

A student in Class 1-A, chosen to enter U.A. via official recommendations. Despite being the ace of his class, Todoroki is very aloof and anti-social, although he gradually warms up to a few of his classmates as the story progresses.

His father, [[Endeavor (boku No Hero Academia)|Endeavor]], is the No. 2 Hero, but Todoroki holds a massive grudge against him thanks to a very rough childhood.

He has [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[red hair|red]] and [[white hair]], [[heterochromia]] (one [[grey eyes|grey]] and one [[blue eyes|blue]]), and a [[burn scar|burn]] [[scar on face| scar]]. His Quirk lets him produce [[fire]] from the left side of his body and [[ice]] from the right.

title: bags_under_eyes
body:
Dark circles or puffiness directly under the eyes. This can occur for a number of reasons, but is often used to indicate stress, [[sleepy|sleepiness]], [[exhausted|exhaustion]], or to give characters a dark appearance. 

Characters frequently seen with this trait include:
* [[Aizawa Shota]] and [[Shinso Hitoshi]] from [[Boku no Hero Academia]]
* [[Fuwa Hyouka]] from [[Shimoneta to Iu Gainen ga Sonzai Shinai Taikutsu na Sekai]]
* [[Kiyama Harumi]] from [[Toaru Kagaku no Railgun]]
* [[Kuroki Tomoko]] from [[Watashi ga Motenai no wa dou Kangaetemo Omaera ga Warui!|Watamote]]
* [[L (death note)|]] from [[Death Note]]
* [[Murasame Reine]] from [[Date A Live]]
* [[Pieck Finger]] from [[Shingeki no Kyojin]]
* [[Vlad Charlie Staz]] from [[Blood Lad]]

title: shinso_hitoshi
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]].

He is voiced by [[Hatano Wataru]].

title: loud_cloud
body: Hero student appearing in [[Boku no Hero Academia]] and [[Vigilante -Boku no Hero Academia: Illegals-]]. [spoilers] He was best friends with [[Aizawa Shota|Eraser Head]] and [[Present Mic]]. He died while still being a student.[/spoilers]

title: aizawa_shota
body:
The pro hero Eraser Head from [[Boku no Hero Academia]], although he is very obscure outside of U.A. since he dislikes media attention. He is the homeroom teacher of Class 1-A. 

He has [[black hair]] that's often [[messy hair|messy]] and [[stubble]] on his cheeks. He wears [[scarf|scarves]] that he uses to entangle enemies. Sometimes seen in a yellow [[sleeping bag]].

title: izumi_kota
body: Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i].
